description:
Delicious Pepperoni Pizza and Mozzarella Sticks! 

Great, speedy delivery, even after ordering after midnight! They are open until 3am, place came in handy since we were visiting and were hungry!
author: Edwin V.

description:
Asked for two slices and was given literally the oldest slices lying out. Didn't realize this until I had a few bites and my pizza tasted like cardboard. I asked to return my slice and get a fresh one but they refused as I had already ate a bit from it. Terrible customer service and food quality, would never recommend anyone to come back here.

2 hours later: stomach issues now, the slice given to me was most likely completely unfit for consumption
author: Bilal J.

description:
I've eaten here a lot over the years. Solid late night option after the bars. However, after my last experience I will not patronize this business any longer. I am only applying this rating to the lack of resolution and if there was one, this place in my eyes would rate more favorably.

I work in the area and my coworkers wanted pizza. We looked on Yelp and saw Milan had free delivery so we ordered an extra large special pizza from them. About 10 minutes later we realized we needed more pizza so we called back and added to the order. We had also seen online at www.milanpizzasf.com they had a deal where if you ordered a three topping pizza or more, they'd sell us another x-large pizza of equal or lesser value for half price. However, they said they did not have any such special deal but would give us a smaller discount. We figured we were hungry so we'd order the pizza and go in to correct them later.

After shift, I went to explain to the manager the situation and even showed him a screenshot of the deal I saw. He said they don't use that website and referred me to another website, www.milanpizzamenu.com, which did not show the deal. The thing is, both websites show up in the top five in the Google results. My problem is, presumably, both websites belong to them, especially since they have the same addresses and same menus. The manager was very polite but still refused to honor the mistake.

I work in the service industry. Suffice to say, if there was an incorrect advertisement, I would correct it and also resolve any issues it might have caused some customers. The manager is a nice enough fellow and although I'm generally not one to tell someone how they should run their business, I would tell them if you want to keep your customers, then own up to your mistakes and resolve it with your customers. There was no resolution to say the least.

Therefore, I and my place of work will no longer patronize this business. Hopefully, they will take down www.milanpizzasf.com and not confuse potential customers any longer.
author: Joshua G.

description: Best pizza place ever.  I'm addicted to their mozzarella sticks and fries. Their pizza tastes amazing and its always hot & fresh.
author: Monique L.

description: Pizza is ok but they can't keep their word. When you order over the phone it's a different price when you show up. Promotions is never honored. Be aware
author: Max A.

description: It's a great take out or delivery spot for late service. We had just arrived to our hotel room from a concert. We were so tired but beat from waking that this place really rescued the night for us. Estimated time was 30 minutes but it was less than that and we ate at a decent time.
author: Marissa S.

description: This little hidden gem makes some very very good pizza.  And if you have a family, order from them because they deliver... quickly.  Its warm when you get it.  It's scary cheap compared to anywhere else.  And I mean cheap.  If you are on a budget go here.   Their small pizza is a medium pizza anywhere else.  And no kidding their medium pizza is too much for one person to eat.  I am not being paid to say this on their behalf, they're just great.  The crust is great too.  And they are friendly.  The deliverers are friendly.
author: Richard B.

description: You have to pay a premium when it's 12 in the morning, you've just left 620 jones, you're drunk and NEED pizza. slices are $5 each which is very expensive when you're going to eat 100 slices- but watever it's worth it! When you're drunk and hungry... You're drunk and hungry.
author: Julianna I.

description:
1) ordered a small California pizza - cold 
2) ordered wings - cold 
3) ordered xtra ranch - not delivered 
4) ordered ice cream- not delivered 
5) placed order at 6:30pm did not arrive until after 8pm 
They did come back with the ranch, ice cream and a 2 liter of coke.
I might give a 2nd chance right now I'm planning on ordering again
author: Big A.

description:
Delicious cheese Pizza! 
Great, quick service.
Will definitely come back.
Plus they are open until 3am, so perfect for a late munch 
Gotta a free side of ranch, owner is really nice and welcoming. Pizza guys are fast and smiling. 
Can't wait to try another one, new fresh ones coming out of the over looks delish! Will take pics for you Yelp friends
author: Hosna A.

description: Lol so at first they told me it was a accident, than they tell me it didnt go through, NOW its it takes 2 days for the refund to go through?  Well here we are 5 days later, double charged with NO REFUND. You guys are scamming people that you dont think will check receipts PERIOD. If you come here look at your bank statements and receipts ALWAYS.
author: Micah M.

description: Worst Pizza place. Their customer service and pricess are ridiculous They charge you a dollar fee for credit card. Their pizza is not fresh. This place is owned by a Jordanian guy who has so much attitude when you order one slice.
author: Ameer S.

description:
Why did you change your crust? It used to be light and flaky now it's the same doughy garbage served everywhere else. 

The people are nice there but this change in crust has ruined it for me. Time to find a new delivery place
author: Marky M.

description: Best pizza around! There are several places within walking distance, but this one is our go to. I always just grab a couple of slices- whatever is fresh. The pesto-feta-mushroom is my favorite. $10 min. credit purchase. Highly recommended!
author: Emma N.

description:
I got two slices of pizza from this little joint- the mushroom pesto and the chicken pesto. If you want two slices and you're paying with card, it's cheaper to just add the ranch (.5) than to endure the .75 card fee!
I found the mushroom pesto to be pretty dry, and I thought the ranch cup was really tiny for .50. Ranch is sooo cheap, surely you can use bigger cups!! However, the chicken pesto was reaallly delicious. The chicken was flavorful and the sauce was nice and juicy. I would come here again to just get two slices of the chicken pesto. And I would bring cash so I could just use ranch from home LOL
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description:
As far as pizza delivery goes, this is pretty good. (I usually order a small pepperoni/pineapple.) If I ever were only rating for delivery restaurants, this would be a four-star, i.e. among the best, but since I'm reviewing it in the context of all restaurants, I'm giving it three. 

If I'm ever hungry late at night, it's either this or Bellissimo Pizza for me.
author: John L.

description:
Three things you need to know about Milan:
1. I thought it was a little heavy on the crust. Felt more like pizza bread then pizza pie. 
2. Tomato sauce was flavorless and did not balance well with the amount of crust. 
3. Cheese was ok and toppings are plentiful. 

Milan has slices for sale and your typical 4 choices pepperoni, mushrooms $ pepperoni, sausage and cheese and it is about 4-5$ per slice. If you need a quick bite in a pinch this will do.
author: Zachary D.

description:
Excellent pizza. Way better than any others in the area. The pizza toppings overflow and the crust is good too. 

The people here are great and they always try to give you everything you need or want. 

They got lots of different types and flavors and even sandwiches. Great place for a fast bite. They sell slices too. 

Good price. Excellent product. What more can you ask for?
author: Jesse J.

description: I tried only vegan options there and they were really good! Recommendation: buy fresh ones or tell them to keep more in the stove for a longer time.
author: Mukhammadali O.

description:
If you want your delivery food go take two hours when it's less than a mile away order from here ... I was told my food would be delivered to my hotel room
And  the delivery man called an stated he could not deliver to my room. Never thought it would take 2 hours for a medium pizza to be made and delivered .5 miles away.....
author: Leah M.

description: I am visiting from So Cal and we were craving pizza so tried this place. It was fabulous! The cheese they use is particularly unique and tasty. We had the vegetarian calzones. The service was friendly also which is always nice.
author: Mary B.

description:
2.5 Stars

Let me just say, it's truly difficult to find a place to eat in Union Square after drinking past midnight outside of Jack in the box and some questionable pizza joints (Milan included) 

Since we have never been, we figured we give it a shot and see if we could find a hidden gem

First off, minimum required on card or they charge you extra for it (believe $10 or more or they add $.50) 

One slice is sufficient unless you truly are a big eater and like dough, toppings are subpar at best and lastly sauce is flat 

Please note, when they get busy they are all over the place, they gave my friends order away to someone else and then gave him attitude when he asked to get a different slice since he paid for two and only got one 

Overall Thoughts

Mediocre food at its finest, even after bar crawling all night
author: Eddie W.

description: First time here from S. Cali. Very good service and the best pizza!! Had a great lunch date w my husband
author: Monica A.

description:
Best food to fill your stomach with on a night of drinking. I went bar hopping with 3 friends 2 weeks ago, and after a few bars, we ended up here. The place is small, so it's not much of a hang out area. It's more for on-the-go service. All of our pizza was warm and delicious. The variety of flavors was interesting. We had a chicken pesto pizza, cheese pizza, mushroom pizza, and your classic pepperoni pizza. 

I'm thankful that none of us experienced stomach issues either!
author: Brenda Y.

description: Ordered late night delivery to our hotel and the mans was super prompt and amicable. also kinda hot if u ask me. who doesn't like a cute pizza delivery guy ?
author: Sofia E.

description: It was good there's a lot of pizza places in sf this isn't anything special but it is good pizza so I wouldn't think it's a bad idea to come to this place if you're craving pizza
author: John C.

description: If I was piss drunk leaving a bar I'd eat here again...other than that I won't return. Staff was nice though
author: Nick E.

description: Not gonna lie, I told my partner that the place looked kinda gross because of the location. But the Pizza is FYAH!! I can honestly say that this is the best pizza on this side of town in San Francisco! I would recommend the cheese for anyone who isn't a huge toppings fan. For those willing to explore, the chicken pesto, pepperoni and sausage and pepperoni and sausage is all good. Kind of pricey for a slice. It tbh it gets the job done.
author: Kojuan W.

description: Macaroni and cheese is definitely Stoffer's repackaged and the pizza doesn't have much of a taste and has stale dough. Do not recommend. Order came on time, though.
author: Nicole S.

description:
An average pizza joint. The pizzas are okay and never that great. My favorite is pepperoni and mushroom with jalapenos. To be fair the only times I've been here are after a night out or last-calls. Usually, I'm not that hungry after the liquid dinners. By then, my taste buds are compromised.

The place is small, with an L-shaped counter and a few stools. There are a couple of tables for four, and a table for two, toward the back.

Also, it deserved an extra star for opening so late. The good thing about eating here so late is it seemed to prevent hangovers the next day. To me, not many late night eats can claim that.
author: Peter L.

description: 2.5 stars. Trying to find late night dining was limited..this place was down the street from our hotel. I must not have drank enough before eating the pizza, it was not good. If I had a few more drinks I am sure I would have been much more satisfied, like one is when drunkenly endulging. Maybe I am a pizza snob? I have had my fair share of pizza, this place is fine though if your starving, maybe the daytime pizza is different than their late night pizza? Fyi If your looking at their menu online, they dont have everything late at night! Pizza slices are HUGE!
author: Jessica M.

description:
I love pizza and I can be satisfied with just about any pizza. This pizza is not good. Flavorless sauce, not enough cheese, almost no toppings. This is flavored bread, and it is not even a good flavored bread. I regret ordering an extra large thinking I was getting a good deal. 

Oh and the wings are awful as well. Very slimy. 

I feel bad writing this review but I have got to warn those who are okay with any pizza that this place should be avoided.
author: Koohyar H.

description: Good pizza by the slice. Service was super friendly. Lots of homeless outside the door though. However, it's SF. There's homeless everywhere.
author: Monica D.

description:
On Friday nite I was starving I did not find place for food. It was Milan pizza which was opened late nite 
The delivery was in time and he was very nice to me 
And the pizza also was awesome it was worthfull .
author: Kaleem P.

description: We got 4 slices pepperoni, Hawaiian, bbq chicken and chicken pesto. I got the chicken pesto and it was super yummy, bbq chicken was good too! My bf got the other two which he said were really good. Would definitely go back!
author: Jazz A.

description: Good pizza, great crust, lots of options. By the slice or order a whole pie, but they wouldn't let me customize my slice.
author: Helen B.

description:
Had a craving for pizza last night so I ordered through Eat24 and:

1. Pizza was delivered 90 minutes after I ordered.
2. Paid 20+ bucks for a medium and received a small, cold dry a*s pizza with barely any toppings.
3. Pre-paid my tip but delivery person would not deliver to my front door.
4. Pizza was supremely mediocre at best; Domino's tastes better for less than half the price ... no joke!
5. When called Eat24 to inform them of the error, they stated I was wrong then apologized after I broke it down for them.
6. Totally ruined my much anticipated night in.

If Yelp doesn't bury this review so no one can read it, don't make the same mistake I did.
author: Doug V.

description:
THE place to go when it's late! Is it possible to find better pizza in SF? Of course. A few minutes walk from Union Square at 1:00 AM...no way! I ordered at the restaurant...it's a little joint with a big menu. I ordered my pie and waited. The choices in the Case were hot, looked delicious, and ready to go. So wanna bust a move back to headquarters...grab some slices and roll!  ALL looked awesome! My wife likes artichoke hearts so...I ordered half Paris (chicken, sun dried tomato, artichoke) and half buffalo chicken. Both were great, with a great ratio of sauce, dough, and toppings. The guys in charge hand tossed the dough before my very eyes! I also ordered buffalo wings. I prefer them crispy...the dude cooking my wings showed me the progress in the oven until they were perfect! It was really fun, moments from my hotel, and delicious!! 
Want a pizza with caviar, bechamel, and a hand delivered organic duck egg...guess you better plan ahead! 

See...how nice they are there. Awww!!
author: John M.

description: I went here the first night I started to not eat meat why did I do that the pizzas was looking so good I almost gave in but my will power game is strong lol so I went on a hunt 3 days later and I found it and I'm now hooked I didn't get any meat I only got cheese but the crust was bomb.com I don't even due ranch dip but I tried it and it made my crust popping I am hooked forever now and the staff here is awesome they always smiling so that's a plus for me I love friendly people
author: Sherisa W.

description: Totally Enjoyed my slice of supreme pizza earlier after my sightseeing outing. It totally hit the spot.
author: C A.

description: Terrific pizza! Freshly made. Am Visiting from Hawaii And was craving some old style pizza - - this place was it. Perfect amount of cheese, not too much tomato sauce, fresh baked crust.  Call ahead because it takes about 30 minutes to cook your pizza. The Calzone was excellent too. We are vegetarian, and enjoyed the flavors.
author: Leo O.

description: Generally disappointing pizza; got a slice of the chicken pesto, which had a lot of dough, crust was not crispy, and was pretty dry. $5 for the slice after tax. I prefer a slice of Nizarios chicken pesto by far. That being said, Milan is open late and I could imagine not caring about the doughy crust if I was drunk. So I'll give them some credit for that =)
author: Will H.

description: Super bummed about Milan pizza. Had delivered to hotel via while staying in San Fran last pm. Pizza & cheese sticks were cold. Delivery driver conveniently didn't have change so he swindled a $13 tip out if me on a $37 order  food would have been excellent had it even been luke warm, it was C O L D.
author: k f.

description: Where could you find delicious pizza , affordable price and super super fast delivery except in Milan i order delivery almost twice a week and it is always my first choice when i'm thinking about a late night bite the guy working there who wears eyeglasses is awesome and cheerful keep it up MILAAAAAN
author: Sherif E.

description: I love pizza. I have a very high pizza standard. I've tried about a MILLION pizza places in the area and have been disgusted by most - which are usually too bready, too greasy, too flavorless. Milan is consistent: it's perfectly browned on top (always cooked to perfection) FULL of flavor, and always fresh. It is reminiscent of a 90s pizza party! But seriously - I don't understand the negative reviews, this is a solid pizza place. And although ordering pizza is usually a hassle, this place makes delivery a breeze. Try it for yourself!
author: Isabel T.

description: Good joint for a quick pizza. they have a great variety of pizzas by the slice.  The pizza was too doughy for my personal taste but good.   plus points were: all meats are halal, and one slice portion is large.. plenty for most.
author: Amer S.

description: Quick and delicious, We stopped for a quick bite and they offered fresh still in the oven pizza when there some on the counter they could have sold us...
author: Maria Elena G.

description: Your regular hole in the wall joint for a quick bite. We tried the vegetatian pizza, the veggie pesto and the cheese pizza. The veggie and the cheese pizza were really good!! The pesto was kind of weird. It wasn't the best tasting and melted feta cheese is not really my jam.
author: Ashmita V.

description: We ordered the large Milan specialty pizza through the yelp app as a pick up order. Definitely a great tasting pizza and it was a good price for the size. Another plus was that the order was ready sooner than the time that the app told us!
author: Ally L.

description:
PIZZA: Open late night for your after clubbing "hangry" eaters like myself. They sell by the slice and have it displayed so you can see what the pizzas look like. I opted for combination and picked off the onions and bell peppers like I usually do. Not bad pizza. You pay extra 50 cents for a ranch dressing. Sodas are in the fridge by the register in cans. 

INSIDE: Small joint with counter seating against the wall, and some group tables at the very back, but it is cramped. If you sit back there you feel like you're in the way of staff members walking to the back to get supplies and the bathroom is back there too. 

OVERALL: A-OK three stars. I feel bad for the staff members because they have to deal with so many drunk people and take phone orders. The staff seemed nice, at least the guy that helped me seemed nice especially when he asked a group to quiet down he was nice about it even though I'm sure he was super annoyed. Street parking outside on either side of the street. Beware there are people asking for change out front. Or do what one of our friends did and buy them a slice of pizza.
author: Michelle M.

description: Best halal pizza in town! Great service and very delicious food. Perfect if just need a quick bite.
author: Dean H.

description:
Its not great. As other reviews -- cold delivery...Very rude person over the phone. It was so disgusting. Pizza was not delivered even after an hour..so i called for an inquiry..that a*** was so rude.

Taste is average. Its too cold.
author: Chaitanya V.

description: I have come across French fries that have been mediocre. Milan Pizza fries puts all other fries (that I've had) to shame. Comes in warm but no big deal. They're not greasy and have a good crunch to them. A definite plus for this one.
author: Nyawira K.

description: Definitely a decent slice of pepperoni. If you're in the area I definitely recommend grabbing a slice or 2. I walked in, grabbed a slice and nearly scarfed it down as I was walking out  Open late!
author: Diego A.

description:
Awful.  Too doughy, too few toppings, just all-around terrible pizza.  The worst I've ever had.  After tonight's pizza, I've finally had it.  Never again.

Do not order a pie from this place.  I've tried to give them a chance, have ordered at least ten or fifteen pies over the years.  All had the same problem: too doughy, too few toppings, and for some reason the last three or four inches of the pie on the outside have no toppings at all.  Also tried ordering a calzone once, overcooked and all dough with little toppings.  Burnt. 
 The worst.

In person is a different story: if you order by the slice, most of the pies in the window look OK.  I suppose it makes sense; nobody is going to to buy a slice of the doughy bullshit pizza you get if you order a whole pie.  But please take my advice after several failed attempts at supporting this place over the years: order your whole pies and calzones somewhere else.
author: Michael G.

description:
What do I want after closing down a nearby bar?! That's right! Pizza! After numerous cocktails, a group of us came to Milan. Nothing like a huge slice of pizza to soak up all the alcohol! Since there was a group of us, I was able to try 3 different slices:

-Pepperoni
-Pepperoni & mushrooms
-Milan special: salami, pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers, sausage & onions

Make sure they heat up the slice, since it's better when the cheese is all melty. I really enjoyed the Milan special since it had veggies. Even late at night, I want my vegetables! The Pepperoni & Pepperoni and mushroom were great as well. I love the pizza basics!

For a quick slice, Milan does the trick!
author: Elena N.

description: I paid 20 dollars and the guy didnt give me the change then left.
author: Wing Shan L.

description: Ignore other reviews. This place has spectacular pizza. The crust is indescribably good. The edges are a bit too doughy but it's still really good. A bit pricy at ~$5 a slice though. Get a full pizza instead.
author: Dominic P.

description: I usually don't eat late at night, but when I do this place is easily one of the spots that come to mind. Pizza slices ready to go and for delicious sandwiches try out their Philly! Good people serving good food.
author: Mike H.

description:
Good pizza. Large slices. 

If you're not paying attention, it is very easy to walk past this place. Luckily for me and the people I was with, we had to wait for an Uber. Which meant us just standing there on the sidewalk looking around. 

The inside is a little small but definitely nothing really worth complaining about. The worker was very nice and social. 

The one thing that shocked me about this place was the free delivery. Are you kidding me?! That's awesome. You can order your pizza online as well. 

Finally, the pizza. The pizza was made fresh, which took about 8 minutes from prep to it coming out of the oven. The price was not bad at all and they take cards.  It's very common that a small place like this will only take cash, which is so inconvenient. 

This is a great place to stop by for some pizza! 

Enjoy!!!
author: Joshua R.

description:
Pizza was okay...
Buffalo wings are salty...
prices are alright though...
author: Peter N.

description: Solid spot for a slice of pizza after the bar. Price is about $4 for a slice of pepperoni. $3 for cheese! I did notice that the speciality kinds of pizza were sliced a tad bit smaller.. My cheese pizza was yummy!!! A good amount of cheese on a thin, but crisp crust! Will definitely return when I'm grabbing a drink around lower nob hill.
author: C P.

description:
The delivery took a really long time. About an hour for one pizza,  fries and an order of mild wings. The place is down the block from the hotel I stayed at, so it shouldn't have taken that long. It was really nice of the gy to deliver it all the way to my room though. My friend and I were a bit intoxicated and we didn't want to go to the lobby to get it... 

The fries were really soggy, and the wings were just alright. The pizza is really good though. Just ordered cheese, nothing special. But the sauce is delicious... I'd say just  stick with the pizza and pick up if you can.
author: Marci B.

description: We ordered a pizza to be delivered to our hotel room. It turns out that the restaurant is only a 2 minute walk away. Pizza arrived at hotel room quickly (20 mins) was hot and very tasty.  No hesitation to recommend this place for pizza!
author: Sean M.

description:
Buyer beware: 

After ordering from this pizza place three times in a row, the pizza has been late, cold, with congealed cheese all three times. Do not order from them.
author: Cody R.

description:
Today I got a plain cheese 14" pizza, cheese garlic bread, and two things of marinara sauce. The delivery was decent as far as timing. The only knock is the fact that one of my marinara was effectively empty when I received it because of how it was placed in the box. The food however is a different story.
Pizza:
The crust was pretty tasteless. The cheese was nothing special either. The thing I tasted the most of was the sauce. It is definitely seasoned, maybe a little too much. Either that or it seems that way because of the blandness of the rest of the pizza. It was definitely edible, but I have had better. Also, the cheese was a little overcooked for my liking.
Cheese Garlic Bread:
Another thing I have had better. I assume they cooked it first because the cheese wasn't really melted any more. It has more taste than the pizza, so that is a plus.

Overall, I have had better and I expected a little better. I would still order from this place, but probably something different.
author: Neil S.

description: Delicious pizza, except they got one of the toppings wrong and put artichokes instead of anchovies. Would order from here again.
author: Mia F.

description:
Ok so I was kind of skeptical ordering a pizza from a restaurant that delivers until 2 am, but then I remember that this was San Francisco and every restaurant has high expectations. I was not wrong. This pizza was so good, I ate the whole box. I forgot the pizza that I ordered, but I think it was the supreme pizza. and it was great. 

I would definitely go and visit this place again when I visit the great city of San Francisco again.
author: Melvin M.

description:
Im a airline crew member and after a long day I wanted to just relax in my room and enjoy some pizza. I took a shot at ordering from Milan's. It took them 45 minutes to deliver it to me but when it got to me it was nice and hot and very delicious! 
I got the Milan special...there are plenty of ingredients and the taste is superb!
author: Jeff A.

description: just look at the photos of this pizza and i dont need to say nomore honestly
author: Abigail S.

description: Sausage & pepperoni pizza was great! Decent price for a whole pizza in the city! Halal meats :) I've walked-in and ordered for delivery and both times the pizza was hot and fresh.
author: Noor S.

description: The pizza is so good I order the pizza and the wings and the 2litter of soda for 29 dollars good deal and tasty my friends they loved it the service was good the staff was so friendly I will go back and have their awesome pizza and wings thanks Milan pizza
author: Abo Karma E.

description: Do let this hole in the wall pizza joint fool you.  Great pizza and the guys were very engaging.  And, they knew their Futbol.  I recommend the pesto, mushroom, and feta.  Yum!
author: 14Porschegirl ..

description: I LOVE the pizza from Milan. Sometimes the wait for delivery is an hour+ but personally worth it to me.
author: Anna J.

description:
I love this place....consistently awesome pizza.
Great place to run into locals and tourists.
A must visit place....
author: Augusto L.

description: I wanted to give a good review, one, asking them to cook my dough longer/crispy. I was trying to make the order very simple. So after about an hour, my pizza arrived. And it was cold. I thought it was very disappointing. I set it up so that they would not fail me. But my pizza was cold. That sucks. I had cold pizza.
author: Chasity R.

description:
I've ordered from here 6-7 times since my first review - and it's always delivered fast, the pizza is delicious and hot!

Love this place!
author: Ryan M.

description: Ordered super late,  delivery was still available.  Pizza, Philly cheesesteak, chocolate mousse pie and soda for $34.00 and the food was amazing!  Great experience
author: Joelene J.

description: Well I guess I'm like one of your other customers...   As much as ice tried, I clearly see that even inspire of my order being the last of the night. They charged me for & didn't deliver another significantly important item on my order as well as following the instructions listed in my additional items.......
author: Chrystal S.

description: Love, love, love this place. Pizza is so good here and it is such a great price! The place itself is a little small, so this is definitely more of a place to take out instead of sit down. They also have really good options for other people who don't want pizza, so everyone can get something they like! Their salad are really big and also a great price. Onion rings, Jalapeño poppers, and fries are super tasty.
author: Kiana H.

description:
This place blows ! Highly not recommend pizzeria. 
The pizza is not authentic in taste. If you like 7/11 pizza than you might like this place. 
But I would recommend sticking to the cheap gas station pizza if you're taking that route because this place is about 22$ for 4 slices. 

WAY better pizza joints in SF for a cheaper buck.
author: S. Z.

description: Surprisingly amazing pizza!  Tiny whole in the wall... Almost looks like a throw away restaurant but the food was really good! I'd go back!
author: Young-Ju O.

description:
Cool!! A place open late for us drunken post-club goers to sober ourselves.  

We ordered their Milan Specialty Pizza and Calzone.  It took almost 40 minutes to complete the order (minus one star for that).  The pizza was absolutely delicious! Can't say the same about the Calzone, too much dough and not enough "stuff".  They also ran out of peppers that night, booo.  But the staff was friendly and courteous, and definitely soccer fans.  Just be careful parking and walking around that area, not the safest place to be during the post-club hours.
author: Hugh B.

description: I've been to this place a few times after a good night at a bar, club or just hanging out with friends... plus this place is just a few blocks from my house. So I decided let's get some delivery, BAD IDEA!!! I ordered a small Hawaiian with jalapeños and 10 piece buffalo wings, it took them over an hour to deliver to an apartment that is 3 blocks away from them!! Literally walking distance, once I got a call from the delivery guy telling me he was outside with my food I came out and his no where to be found. I came out through the side door and nothing. Then I realized he was a cross the street on his car on his phone doing who knows what!! He called and again and I told him I was outside and he seem like he wanted me to go to him and pick up my food.. ITS CALL DELIVERY for a reason. Anyways after I got my food I came inside my apartment I open the box off wings and it was 10 of the saddest and driest wings I've seen!! No buffalo sauce literally no sauce not even on the side or even ranch.. I checked my receipt thinking maybe I had made a mistake and order plain wings and it clearly said BUFFALO WINGS. Then I opened the box of pizza and I got even more mad cause it was warm/cold... So my point is I'm never ordering from this place again!! Sorry
author: Enjoy S.

description:
Usually local pizza joints get hit by bad reviews because of their delivery service, which is why I'm pleasantly surprised by my experience with Milan Pizza. 

After a night of clubbing, my friends and I were on the hunt for pizza and needed a place that 1) Was open at 2 a.m., 2) Had reasonable prices (another pizza place we called wanted to charge $26 for a one topping medium pizza) and 3) Would deliver to us without a ridiculous fee (FYI: Milan Pizza delivers for FREE!). 

Ordering over the phone was a breeze and the pizza arrived in the 30 to 40 minutes as they promised. Make sure you check their online coupons. We scored a delicious medium, 3-topping pizza (that actually could've passed for a large), garden salad and two cans of soda for about $20 with tax and tip. It was so delicious!!

Our only complaint: they forgot to slice the pizza, probably in their hurry to deliver on time!
author: Essie K.

description: Perfect pizza to order after a night out! Open til 3am! And they deliver! Seriously tasty pizza! You won't be sorry! When the pizza was delivered it was still really hot! Just like fresh out of the oven! Amazing!!!!
author: Luis R.

description: The cheesy bread was amazing !!! The cheese stick were good too !! My good was nice and hot and the delivery guy was polite and friendly.
author: Velda M.

description:
I've been here tens and tens of times, and honestly, have never purchased anything but a single slice of pizza each time.

Their slices are big. Perhaps not a full meal for a 200-pound man, but a great filler at any time, and this place is open late. It's definitely a fast and easy option. A cheese slice will run you $2.75, and other types range between $3-$4. You can pay by credit card but there is a $10 minimum on that, so bring cash.

The pizza here is pleasantly good! Depending on who you are you may or may not want to use a napkin to soak up all that oil on top of your pizza before you get going though.... The dough and crust are pretty good and I've been happy with whatever pizza I've picked each time. Granted you're not expecting anything fancy.

Judging by all the soccer jerseys you see hung up there - my bet is that this place was named after Italian soccer team AC Milan rather than anything to do with Italian pizza.
author: Nizar S.

description:
I am a pizza critic and did not think this place would be as good as it was. I was staying at the Clift hotel next door and decided to order a half pep half cheese and it was amazing. Top 5 best pizzas I have Ever had. 


It was awesome... Can't stress it enough. GO
author: Mercedes C.

description: Amazing pizza and they are open late my favorite slices are pesto chicken, Monaco, and the mushroom sausage is really good, if your getting a full pizza I would highly recommend the San Francisco or California
author: Ahmed A.

description:
By far the best pizza I've ever had!!! 
New go to pizza!!!! Absolutely obsessed with the calzone and pepperoni pizza 
In love!
author: Lulu A.

description:
Disclaimer: This is the first review I've ever done, so bear with me. I signed up for a Yelp account just to start reviewing places I think deserve it. And Milan pizza deserves it.

I read TONS of reviews about this place that are all over the place and IMO, its some damn good pizza. We went in after a night of low-key partying at 620 Jones. It was the perfect pizza at the time, and I can only imagine its the perfect pizza at all other times as well. It's thick crust is just magnificent and the toppings on my combo slice seemed pretty fresh.

They were pretty busy at the time, but we managed to snag a table in the back. It's not the cleanest looking pizza joint on the inside, but it didn't bother me too much - its such a small place and I've seen much worse.

I read several reviews that say their delivery guy/process is awful and awfully slow. I'm somewhat excited to try it out and see how it turns out. With tons of negative reviews in that department, you'd think they'd try and make it better. I'm all about customer service so I will update this review when I order for delivery.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
This is my fav pizza in the city!!! Nothing fancy here.. Just great pizza!! 

Saw someone else getting wings while I was waiting for pizza.. Decided to try em and now I'm addicted lol.. Wings are bomb!
author: Jose B.

description: We were searching EVERYWHERE for a place to eat while on vacation here. We finally decided on just ordering pizza. We found this place on Yelp and the delivery guy was on time. They quoted 45-50 minutes. We just ordered small cheese pizza and wings. The wings were really good!!!!!
author: Chris D.

description: I ordered a medium size pizza with half pepperoni and half just cheese along with a side order of cheese fries. The price was amazing. We paid like 20 bucks for everything and they delivered it to our hotel! Plus it said it would be delivered in about an hour but the guy showed up 20 minutes early. The cheese fries were alright. Just your regular fries covered in what tasted like 7-11 nacho cheese. The pizza was pretty good. Its a little too thin for me but it was still nice and filling. The sauce was full of flavor as well. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but then again it's hard to beat free delivery in under 30 minutes in San Francisco!
author: Justine C.

description: Waited 45 minutes for wrong order: wrong soda, wrong fries, charged for ranch x2, did not receive
author: Sherry U.

description: A man who owned the liquor store I went to referred us to this place, my cousin and I needed a quick note to eat to prepare ourselves for a night of drinking haha. This pizza is pretty good, I went in there with low expectations and ended up pleasantly surprised. The workers are nice and it seemed pretty clean. Customers were coming in that seemed like regulars & they guys seemed pretty good at recognizing familiar faces. I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Renee F.

description: I love this pizza and the owner  very good owner and very good service and the place is very clean and its nice for famlies and the staff is very nice
author: Aghlab Z.

description: They provide terrible service. If you call to inquire as to what the delay is with your order, they play hot potato with the phone cal and send it to various people at the restaurant and in the end hang up on you. It is the WORST service I have received since coming to San Francisco.
author: Massiel A.

description: Simple pie with basic toppings - each slice is extra large, with a soda it's five clams and change. Sometimes local Tenderloin residents wander in and cause problems, and that's always a hoot. I think the place has been sold to another family but can't be sure.
author: Frank L.

description: Great pizza !! Delivery to my hotel at the Hilton! Came very fast and yummy! I asked for plates and they didn't give me any :( but it was ok it was still good ass pizza! Nice job!
author: Mir W.

description:
This was my third order in two weeks.  Wanted an evening snack since I skipped dinner and decided on my second try on a Philly steak sandwich (comes with fries) and a pint of Ben & Jerry's ice cream for dessert.  

The roll was extremely hard and rubbery, unlike the first try on the Philly steak sandwich last week which was fresh and softer, like all buns should be.  That was not the crime but the Ben & Jerry's ice cream was melted and came like a softie cone (the second time in a week it has happened).  I had to refrigerate it so the consistence was a little firmer, knowing that gourmet ice cream should never be eaten frozen hard (nor softie soft).

I will not give them another try to strike out, there are too many businesses out there to try in San Francisco.
author: Tamara C.

description: Pizza delivery took almost 2 hours on a Monday. The food itself wasn't bad, but the expectations set were all wrong, and it felt like a night wasted. Due to understaffing or something, service was horrible.
author: Jason A.

description: Delivery is on time! Pizza tastes fine and chicken is a bit dried! Overall experience is good!
author: Shanti W.

description:
Ordered for pick up and the guy on the phone was rude and unhelpful.
On their online menu, it says the deal is a large pizza with 10 wings and a 2 liter for $23. They tried to say that they don't have a deal like that, and then switched up when I said I wasn't going to order anymore. I also ordered the SMALL vegetarian calzone, which the menu said was $13...... And they charged me $17. Not sure if this is how they treat everyone? Also seemed mad that I pointed out what their menu read.

So anyways the FOOD:
They did indeed give me a huge calzone & insisted it was a small. It wasn't very flavorful. I put pepper flakes on it to make it taste better.
Friends said the pizza was decent.
The wings I ordered to be buffalo and not spicy came spicy.

Probably wouldn't come here again unless starving.
author: Melissa S.

description: I liked this place a lot. Located 6 blocks away from the hotel I was staying (the Westin St. Francis San Francisco). What a great hotel that is. I will save that for a seperate review. Milan Pizza is a really small place that specializes in slices. A single slice will run $4.00 but believe me that is enough. Slices are gigantic so if you able to finish more than 1 slice you should get your picture on the wall.LOL.-Will
author: Will H.

description:
Stopped for a late night quick slice of pizza and I wish I did not. I don't  like to write these reviews but I was so hungry to eat anything but the pizza was thin not appetizing at all I couldn't Es the slice had to eat Frozen food I had in my fridge 
Maybe off night but I will order again to give them another chance.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Stumbling along the TL looking for a late-night bite...
Suddenly someone yells, "Pizza!" ...and everyone's like hells YEAH!

Milan Pizza ain't the best I've had, but it's the BEST thing to eat after a night of drinks cuz after I'm drink, drank, & drunk, I pretty much look for three things when in my search for FOOoOoOoOD!

#1. Fresh HOT pizza with greasy toppings & salty cheese!
#2. Thick chewy crust to absorb my night of FUN!
#3. Cheap eat... paid with the last $5 in my wallet.

CONVENIENCE: *** [Located in heart of TL, Approx corner of Geary & Jones St., a great stumble to sober up and end the night.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Small hole in the wall, barely noticeable, stand at bar to devour slice.]
SERVICE: ***** [Fast & efficient!  Much props to the employees for having to deal with the late-nighters.]
PRICE:  $  [$4.75 for a slice, I think?  I remember I got a bit of change back.]
OVERALL: ***/* [3.5-stars rounded up... only cuz I wouldn't go out of my way to come back for a slice, unless I'm already in the area.]

Nuff said.

[44 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description: WOOOOOW lemme tell YOU: so it's finals week and yo girl just wanted pizza and cheesecake to help with studying...I was super happy to see Milan Pizza open till 3, however, 30 minutes after closing time, I was left hangry and annoyed. After an hour and a half of waiting for it, I finally called up the restaurant to confirm the status of my order. At first  the owner told me that the delivery person called me 9 times, then he claimed they called me 5 times... more like 0 times. I checked my phone log and literally NO calls from Milan Pizza. The clincher is when he told me I could drive down to pick up my order. BRUHH I didn't order DELIVERY for shits & giggles. Literally the worst. I won't be ordering from Milan Pizza again.. finals week or not.
author: Bea B.

description: Jesus fuck, I am reborn!! Get the one with beef and cheese on top and its fucking madness!! Holy shit I'm alive!!!! I did it. Pizza!!!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Crust: chewy and dry, yet too much sauce. Sauce: way too much garlic. Fries: soggy and soaked in oil. Delivery: took an hour and there was a random guy in the car who ended up being the guy to contact me instead of my driver.

They seemed very busy, or maybe just understaffed. But I'm just weirded out that some random guy was in the car. 

After eating, I had to puke. Very gross
author: Rayna K.

description: I have ordered delivery from this place many times and I have been meaning to give them props for a while. I have only gotten delivery, but in doing so the pizza is hot and -- oh sooo damn tasty! Also, let me tell you about their ranch - it is not some squeeze tube bull crap, it is delish!!! Cheesy melty goodness + damn good ranch = my perfect spot. I order from them EVERY time I get pizza delivered. If I had 10 thumbs Milan would get it -- thx guys for hitting the spot every damn time!
author: Sophia F.

description: A friend of mine told us about this place said it was great. It did not disappoint at all pizza by the slice was great and pretty good prices as well
author: Joe M.

description: Small cozy and local pizza place. We had a slice of pesto chicken and fries. The taste was good. They were friendly and fast. It's good if you're out and starving on the weekend nights out.
author: Majid D.

description: Yummy pizza just in time for my toddlers. Friendly workers and tables in the back. A nice break as we trekked around San Fran!
author: Kinzley M.

description:
Their crust/dough is so bomb. it's super fluffy and thick, and the balance between sauce and toppings is perfect. The delivery service is great, came on time, also free which is also a plus. 
We got their California pizza which gets an A+
author: Vanessa C.

description: Great Pizza and open till 3 am every night ! Highly recommend their meat combination. Great staff
author: Yazan Z.

description: It was delicious, a bit salty but it was good! I will definitely order pizza from this place again!
author: Lidia G.

description:
Best. Pizza. Ever. 

I live in New York and I wish,WISH we had this there. 
Thank you. Thank you for changing my life.
author: Fariba B.

description: Great late night pizza spot. Came here after a concert in Oakland. Originally from OC but the pizza and wings were amazing.
author: Ramin O.

description:
Came here very hungry with a few friends and didn't expect too much, but was pleasantly surprised. The pizza is good and the price is fair. I'd go again if in the same situation, but not if I was searching for best pizza in the city. 


I had to ask multiple times for Parmesan and red pepper packets, as each time I went up to get enough for my group of 5 I was given one of each. But besides that, a pleasant experience!
author: Marilyn M.

description: Its the best... so amazing that I cant stop eating more pizza every time I come here I want more pizza.
author: Anwar I.

description: Great Pizza delivered at 3:30am is like a dream come true!  (Ordered at 2:45am). Try the Milan or pepperoni.  Dangerously Delicious.  :-)
author: Michael C.

description: Got a slice of Hawaiian and pepperoni and mushroom pizza for a late night snacky. There was a crispy crunch on the bottom of the pizza that was good! You can't go wrong with a slice of this greasy, cheesy, late night pizza on the go!
author: Christine P.

description: Awesome experience! Great service great pizza very crunchy and Extremely fresh can definitely see the guy tossing and turning the dough. Will recommend to anyone! Marinara sauce is mouth watering. Sausage is spicy! Just can't believe is next door from I'm staying lmao  but downside there's not enough room to sit there's only 3 tables and top!
author: Annie S.

description:
Decent selection of slices and a fair price. Definitely worth stopping here, over hitting something like Nizario's later on in the Richmond. 

Get the BBQ chicken slice or Hawaiian---they're generous with the toppings. Slices also reheat well.
author: Brandon J.

description:
Nasty. Ass. Pizza. 

I was drunk and this pizza wasn't good. That's not a good sign. 

Avoid this hole even if it's the last thing open.
author: Barry C.

description: At first glance, this place is just your regular around the corner pizza joint, but your mind and taste buds will be blown away when you come here. My friends and I came here after a few beers and we were pleasantly surprised by how nice and accommodating the staff was and how yummy the slices of pizza were. Definitely coming back!
author: Theo T.

description:
I would give this less than 1 star of I could. We ordered a pizza and they totally messed it up. The rude people working there insisted I ordered something I didn't. My entire family surrounded me and heard my order!  

In addition, it took a ridiculous amount of time to get the crappy pizza. 

Do not go here. We went because of positive reviews. We were fooled. So many good food choices around. Avoid this place at all costs. Beyond rude.
author: Martina Z.

description: A good place to go to late-night delivery was fast . Food is good . Pesto pizza is my favorite
author: Said D.

description:
The owners of this pizza joint are smart.

Why is that?

(a) They are one of the only places open until 4 a.m. on Fridays and Saturdays.

(b) They are located near hostels and several blocks away from bars and clubs

(c) And they serve mediocre, doughy, fluffy pizza. 

Because they can!

However, it's better than nothing when you're out late and you're hungry.
author: Diana V.

description: Like many others have said about Milan Pizza, it's may not be the best pizza in the area, but it definitely hits the spot for after hours eating to after a night on the town. Been here on a couple occasions and they've had some pretty good combo slices.  I've tried their Pepperoni with Jalapenos and their Pepperoni with Mushrooms.  Both were pretty solid slices and are pretty comparable to Nizario's.  Overall, not bad and they're open super late till 3am when dining options around the city are pretty limited.
author: Rodney H.

description: Unfortunately I have to give 2 stars to this place and it isn't for the quality of pizza. The pizza is actually pretty good I really enjoy eating it as I eat here often. The cheese is always really warm, the toppings are always great quality, I have to give a 2 star rating because I order pizza most of the time delivery and the driver never brings change. It's beyond frustrating most times but at least once I'm past it the pizza makes up for it.
author: Krishna V.

description: We ordered a delivery and the pizza was very dry and just overall not good. The delivery guys was also late by 20 minutes. Not going to order again.
author: Arshi K.

description: I ordered a pizza and salad to be delivered. It was delivered on time and the food was delicious.
author: Kristin P.

description:
The pizza here is OK. Definitely not the best pizza I've eaten but decent if one is out of options in TL late at night. Delivery took 60+ minutes. I've had the Milan special (salami, pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers and onions). It wasn't bad but nothing to rave about. 

Pros: late-night delivery, online delivery through Yelp, arrived warm
Cons: too greasy for my taste, some slices had too much dough, not enough cheese, delivery took an hour
author: Irina P.

description: I have never been to a pizza place that refuses to make a cheese pizza. There were no vegetarian options, and all they could do was shrug about it. I don't recommend coming here there are plenty of other places to get food, without the side of attitude.
author: Shilpa Y.

description: Very sweet guys. I offered a homeless man some pizza and they didn't make me pay for it. My heart was touched.
author: Ashley C.

description: This is the best pizza around here.  All the other places are just OK.  It is really tasty delivery, but I also feel like it would be nice if there were, you know, an amazing pizza place here in SF.  Milan Pizza, you earn five stars because there aren't any better places around.
author: Mai O.

description: I had the pepperoni pesto pizza and it had good flavor but it tasted like microwaved  pizza. After being reheated in the oven at Milan, the pizza was hard and chewy. I'll pass.
author: Naomi D.

description: Good place for a slice late night when you're drunk. I went in my pajamas, flip flops, & no make up. No one cared. Perfect
author: Julia T.

description:
Our hotel recommended two places for late-night pizza and this was supposedly the better one. So I read a bunch of these reviews first and thought I'd take the gamble...the house won.

This is the parlor of last resort. If any one of the pizza strata (crust, sauce, cheese, toppings) were any further from the norm then this would cease being pizza altogether. I've never had any other pizza in San Francisco, so maybe this is how you guys roll, but I find that thought unlikely indeed. 

Also, I got this delivered via EAT24 and they ignored my request to make it well done. Fails all around! Next round's on me!
author: Cranston M.

description: Great service!  Great pizza !  As soon as he heard we were staying in a nearby hotel he made sure we had enough paper plates and napkins.  Price was fair.
author: Renee' S.

description:
HORRIBLE service!! I ordered a salad and I said lettuce and cheese only and my salad arrives with lettuce, cheese and pepperoncinis. I could deal with the pepperoncinis but there wasn't ANY dressing!! I called right away and explained very nicely what happened. They said they'd remake the salad and hung up
on me. I waited for over an hour for the remade salad and never heard a word. I called them back and it still wasn't made and there were zero apologies for the fact that I've been waiting for over an hour at this point with small children (it's now 11:00 pm), they just argued with me about the pepperoncinis!! I will never order from them again and I wish I had my money back for my salad (with NO dressing), pizza and breadsticks. Oh yeah, no napkins either even though they delivered to a hotel room. I'm steaming!!
author: Erin C.

description:
I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO BE AFRAID OF THE PIZZA GUY.

The delivery took 96 minutes and the driver was incredibly rude bordering on threatening. When I called to check his ETA (after he called once and drove away saying he'd come back in 15 minutes), he started yelling at me. I started to wonder if I should even open the door to him. 

When I called Milan to tell them what was going on, the guy on the phone told me the driver was crabby because he'd been fasting all day for Ramadan. Ummm SO HAS MY WHOLE FAMILY and none of us are yelling at strangers on the phone. 

The driver berated me again when he finally came back with my food. As a woman home alone I feel uncomfortable that this guy knows where I live now. What kind of person gets out of their car screaming at a stranger who just asked when you might come back with her pizza? That's not just crabby, that's unbalanced.

The driver was awful but the lack of concern from the restaurant was really  disturbing. Your employee is out here abusing your customers and you make excuses for him? Not ok. I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO BE AFRAID OF THE PIZZA GUY.
author: Aubrey B.

description:
Hands down one of the WORST pizza places I have EVEER dealt with. After ordering pizza for what I was told a 35-45 minute wait they came after an hour. When the delivery man called me and said he was downstairs waiting for cash I informed him I already gave my cc info over the phone. By the time I went downstairs to get my food he had left. I called the number back for the pizza guy to inform me they lost my cc number. I was willing to give my cc info again but when u called to confirm they didn't have it the man on the phone was VERY rude and said he never got it. Instead of taking my cc # he told me I was wrong & proceeded to hang up on me. I am a meeting planner and as far as I am concerned I will NEVER recommend them
To any of my clients or anyone I know. Best of luck!
author: April D.

description: They said delivery would take 45 minutes. I waited 90 minutes. When the food finally came it was cold. The pizza was not the greatest and the mozzarella sticks were lacking mozzarella. The delivery guy was disgustingly chewing gum, very unfriendly and seemed like he hated his job.
author: Rafaela D.

description: Milan pizza is the pinnacle of local pizza. They run a tight ship, and they cycle customers very efficiently. Not to mention their friendly demeanor and can do attitude. Many a drunk has been orally satisfied here. Even better when you're coming from 620 Jones.
author: Paolo V.

description:
Ordered from the first delivery place that popped up on yelp after me and a couple girlfriends stumbled back to our friends place. Ordering was quick and easy, time estimate for our large pizza was 40 minutes.

When the delivery guy came, he needed my credit card again (had already gave them the card info over the phone) as well as my id, things I didn't bring on my walk down of four flights. Had to go back for them, and upon leaving, the guy asked for tip - my inebriated self had forgotten but looking back, seems schemey to ask a drunk girl but whatever.

The pizza was pounced on, but the quality of said pizza was not great. 70% super thick bread/crust, pizza was very salty and mainly tasted of just oregano. Decent amount of toppings on our Milan special, but I didn't like the flavor of the meats they used. Cost of ~$26 was worth it in that situation, but not when sober.

Would not order again, but if anyone else were to, check out their website and menu, they have some decent coupons and deals.
author: Nayoun K.

description: BEST PIZZA I HAVE BER TRIED! Huge slices as well. The staff has a great smile and I came from SoCal and they made sure to make me feel special. Ordered one slice age it all then ordered another. Definitely recommend it. Cozy joint on Geary street and open late so perfect for after the bars and clubs. Pizza had a nice crispy under layer yet was so fluffy and delicious on the inside. The crust was great. The cheese wa a great. The sauce was great. Tried mushroom and pepperoni that was great, tried veggie that was great. The staff was great. Just great. Go try it for yourself I highly recommend it!
author: Yekta P.

description: Best halal pizza I have ever had! So fresh, crispy, and toasty! The workers and owner are extremely nice; they take the time to chop it up with their customers and get to know them. We ordered a medium pepperoni and beef pizza with two sodas which totaled out to $20. It's not a typical sit down restaurant since the space is not too big for a crowd (just in case you're with a large group, I suggest ordering for pick up/delivery!) I'll definitely come back when I'm in the area again!
author: Nazanin Q.

description: The only reason why I'm giving this place two stars, is because the driver was very nice and arrived early. I had the "chicken" pesto, it was more bread and lettuce then anything else. Absolutely terrible. My friend had the "pastrami" which was the same, what a rip off! No meat at all for both sandwiches. We couldn't eat the fries because they tasted horrible, who knows how long it's been since they changed their fryer oil.
author: Cesar R.

description: The pizza with feta, green pesto and garlic was de-lish-ious! The other pizza was cold tough...
author: Kim K.

description:
Waiting for the drawing for the Lottery tickets at the Curran Theater a young male usher told me the pizza across the street is just ok & Milan Pizza is better so after not getting tickets to the BOM I had a quick, cheap dinner at Milan Pizza.

They have ready-made pizza so if you just want some slices they will heat it up for you.  I got a Slice of Pesto $3.50 with tax $3.80.  It's really 2 small slices, so it's filling.  Credit card minimum is $10, so I paid CASH.

I ate my 2 slices which they call 1 slice at the counter, but there are some tables/chairs in the back.

I noticed lots of take-out orders & delivery.
author: Ann L.

description: Good pizza, and nice staff. worth any trip at 3 AM.
author: Skylar M.

description:
Really amazing pizza and also very good at room temperature in the morning. I couldn't have been happier with the way this pizza tasted and felt in my mouth. 

I don't know if it was the pizza, but I felt like after I ate it I drifted off into the most peaceful, wonderful sleep. Piece-a-pizza-full. Get it?
author: Kd H.

description:
Stopped in here for a slice after getting drinks up the street. Their crusts were nice and thick and the toppings were fresh and piled high. I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was.

The restaurant itself is tiny and a bit dingy with limited seating, but overall, this is a great spot to pop in if you're looking for late night post-bar nosh in the TL.
author: Sabrina V.

description: Very tasty pizza just across the street from our hotel. We needed a late night snack to soak up all the booze in our system after a night of cocktails!  The crust was thick, the sauces were spicy, and the toppings were plentiful!  This place is no frills, get your slice and go, but I liked it!!
author: Raquel C.

description: Just had my pizza and chix wings delivered. Not only was it on time but delicious! Keep it up!
author: Review M.

description:
Good pizza AND ice cream :)

It's open until reply late at night, so perfect for those post drunken parties/clubbing where you want to sober up a bit.
author: Xander S.

description:
Good pizza. Slow service... but friendly Italian pizza man.

Great spot to hit late at night after a beer... not ideal for optimal health and fitness... but for pizza - give it a try before most other options on the streets of San Fran.
author: Jackson L.

description: I ordered a pizza and bread sticks late at night around 1 and they said it would take 45 minutes for delivery but we waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for dry pizza and dry breadsticks. & By the time it came it was too late to order from any other pizzeria. VRY DISAPPOINTING :CCCC
author: Emily Z.

description: Great Pizza!!! Get the ranch dipping sauce and walk away without spending too much. Its a small place - if your party is big plan accordingly (4+) - no reservation required - show up order and enjoy.
author: Eric W.

description: Worst service for marginal pizza. I stood at the counter and was ignored for 7 minutes. No business for you.
author: Blake Q.

description: Usually not a bad choice for delivery, but there have been a few occasions where they show up super late with a cold pizza that is much smaller than what I ordered.
author: Andrew H.

description: Best pizza around! Open late! Halal! Great customer service. Great people. Awesome awesome delicious pizza. Baked fresh  and have pizza by the slice that's also fresh. Nice clean place. Can't recommend it enough!
author: Rohil J.

description: Service was very good and delivery time was excellent! Pizza tastes classic Italian style. Buffalo wings were a little too dry for my liking but the most important thing is the pizza and it was marvelous.
author: Victor L.

description:
Nice, medium thickness crust pizza with decent toppings. 5* for the price at less than 4$ for a big deluxe slice. But would pale in comparison to higher brow pies. 

For me, a tenderloin cheapskate, its great. The only way it could be better would be if the toppings were a bit thicker.
author: Mike G.

description:
Nothing makes me more bummed than walking around to find an alight bite to eat, settling for something else, and having that something else suck hard. I work in Union Square, and had the misfortune of a 7:45p lunch. With not a lot of choices that fall outside of the Tourist Trap - Overrated by Tourists - Fast Food trifecta, I decided to deal with the extra walk to make it over to Kare-Ken. Unfortunately, it was a Monday, and I was stuck on the outskirts of the TL with 40 minutes left on the clock. After deciding the 10-minute wait for Pharaoh's would be too much to bear, I opted to grab two slices from Milan (one Pepp and Sausage, one Combination). The slices were re-heated, chucked in a box, and came out to $10 even with a Snapple. 

The crust is a thicker build at Milan. I am of the school of thought that if you have a thicker crust, you should compensate for having a healthy quantity of toppings, lest one find themselves eating a mediocre open-faced sandwich. Milan's, suffice to say, did not have this, and the slightly burnt toppings on the Combination did not help. The bright point of the meal (which I ate on the way back to work), was that a homeless dude asked me for a slice (not cash, just a slice), so at least Milan's brightened his night. All in all, not even as good as Blondie's (the desperation pick's desperation pick), and probably not a place I'll be coming back to (sober, at least).
author: Thomas J.

description:
My husband and I were on our way to the airport but really wanted some pizza. We searched for somewhere close with good reviews and OMG we are so happy we did!!! 

Milan Pizza is Incredible!!!! We tried a variety of pizzas because they all looked so good and although we are ridiculously full, we are so happy!! It's hard to come by actually good pizza.

We will definitely be coming back here next trip to SF!!!
author: Oriana V.

description:
My late night spot for pizza, and I love it. Health score is good (which you can't say for many alternative places around that area). Open till really late, very good prices for absolutely great slices with superb toppings.

I don't get the haters, but I also never order from this place, but just walk in.
author: Tin Yan C.

description:
Literally, the worst pizza ever. I was so busy the whole day and forgot to eat. It was literally one in the morning and I was desperate so I ordered delivery. 

The pizza was too thick and was mostly dough. The sauce was so little and the cheese was not of good quality. It was as if you were eating a huge piece of bread. 

With so many choices for late night grub, skip this place!
author: Leslie M.

description: Amazing pizza :D my go to place every weekend when I get out of work around 230/3 AM. They always seem to have so many great options for pizza by the slice and are super friendly every time my co workers and I walk in the door. I definitely look forward to it after a long night at work and am so happy that Milan exists, as it is such an integral part of the TL.
author: Muki M.

description:
I ordered a calzone. Pepperoni, Tomato and Canadian Bacon. It was amazing. Delivery was a bit cold, but I ordered at 1:40am and my place is a bit far. Everything was still delicious. Seriously, I've tried so many pizza places around 8th / Mission and this is the best I've had. I got some garlic bread as well and it was mad.

Though you know what, it's the first time I actually ate a San Francisco Calzone. I usually order pizza.
author: Nicolas P.

description: Definitely one of my favorite pizza spots in the city. I recommend trying the pesto chicken or veggie they are delicious. Staff is extremely friendly and prices are great. You should give this place a try you won't regret it! Extra tip they make their own ranch dressing which is the best I've ever tasted.
author: Mey A.

description:
I was looking for a pizza place downtown that delivered on Sunday and I didn't want Uncle Vito's because their crust is always really soggy. 

I'm happy to say that the pizza was really good and the crust was delicious! I'm definitely keeping them in mind for next time.
author: Devon M.

description: I order from here a lot; I think they've got way better food for slightly better prices than many of their nearby competitors. I usually get delivery and it's always fast and the delivery guys are very friendly.
author: Tyler T.

description: I do t want to give this pLace too harsh of a rating since I didn't order a whole pie but just a slice that was reheated.  I thought the crust was too think and crusty, it impacted the flavor too much.  Now pizza is super subjective, so again, not too be too harsh, but I really didn't like it.  Way too much bread.  The sauce and toppings were fine.
author: Zachary S.

description: Huge slices, generous toppings, good customer service, and great location to grab a bite. I grabbed a slice of the combo and it was super yummy. Even reheated it was better than these other mom n pop shops. It kind of reminded of NYC pizza but not exactly. There are many pizza by the slice places in this area, but this may be the best one.
author: SF N.

description:
I'm feeling more than generous as I write this review.  

Still in my basil-gimlet-happy-feeling state from Rye next door, I was sitting on the counter munching on a slice of hot out of the oven Hawaiian pizza.  For $3.50, I  got a big enough slice to soak up the alchohol currently running in my veins -- with enough cheese, salty ham and sweet pineapple.

It was so good!

I was shouting YIPEEEEEE all the way to the car, when my bf grabbed the keys and said, "I'm driving!".

I don't know how our conversation went after that ,but even in my alcohol-induced state I remembered saying something fierce like:  "hmmm...maybe I'll give you a something-something!!!!"

*He puts on a big smile that stretches from ear to ear *

"OKAAAYYY!!! Now?"

I give him a disgusted look.

"can't you wait until we.....

get home....

* hic * 

zzzzz.....
author: Janice C.

description: Great pizza and friendly staff I would recommend getting the Milan special and a side of mild wings are my favorite, it's also one of the only places open until 4 in the city
author: Waleed A.

description: Haha damn!! Its been months since I been here.. well what can I say. It was pizzza at 2 in the morning that I happened to stumble upon while I was walking around drunk in SF.  All I remember is they had tapatio and I got a fat slice of pizza for cheap and it was good!
author: Andrew J.

description: Great value!. Locally owned operated. The pies are done right and delivered hot.and fresh by friendly drivers. I love these guys.and I can still feed a small family here for about $20.
author: Bryan O.

description: Pizza crust is great!!. i ordered there special and its worth the price!. fast and very affordable!.
author: Angeli H.

description:
I am a fan of the Mild chicken wings here !! I have ordered a few times and the flavors are always spot on!

Minus  2 stars because the pizza can be a bit dough-y but some people like that.

the spicy wings are not that good because they are smothered in sauce and taste soggy but the mild ones are super nice and crispy
author: Fran M.

description: They were close to the Hilton and I had a pizza craving. They had several trays of pizza out that tempted me. The pepperoni and jalapeño was really good and was my favorite. I also had the pepperoni and pineapple. The toppings and cheese are really good and the slices are huge. The crust is a little thicker than what I prefer and it was pretty hard on the bottom - still good though. The price is right and the staff is friendly. It's a good choice when you pizza and something quick.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Very, very delayed delivery via Eat24 app. Driver arrived with cold food, then had no change, trying to force me to overtip for a delivery 75 minutes after I ordered. The pizza is very average, thought I'm sure it would have tasted better hot.
author: Jen W.

description: This is my little neighborhood gem and go to when I need a slice on my way home from work.  The crust is thick, crispy, and has a nice yeasty finish. It heats up nicely in my oven and it's always fresh.  The guys behind the counter even put the Giants game on for me last Friday -- love this place!
author: Christine C.

description: Delivery was quick and the driver was polite. Food somewhat pricey for its quality.  The pizza was cold,  veggies undercooked, kind of bland. My partner and I each ate a slice then gave it to someone on the street. Really not that great, sorry to say.
author: Erica L.

description:
Big slices, friendly guys who work there.
Open really late.
author: Timothy H.

description: Good size slices and great flavor. Crispy crust and just enough toppings for me (I'm not one for tons of sauce or cheese). Good local joint where you can grab and go our stay and eat!
author: Julie S.

description: Another pizza place that doesn't deliver after ordering off a app.  Had to call them and ask them when our pizza was coming and was told they don't deliver to us.    After an hour of waiting.  Negative 1000 stars
author: Mat F.

description:
They're open. and cheap!

Great pizza when you need to soak up some booze at the end of the night.  The mozzarella sticks are so-so, what you'd expect from a hole in the wall pizza joint.  I recommend not getting 4 slices of pie between 2 people, but what do I know.
author: Eric L.

description: Ordered a pizza and 2 cokes on eat24 and restaurant confirmed it would be delivered in 60 mins.  After 75 mins we called the restaurant to check status and heard the guy say in the background say "oh no I forgot to check eat24 orders."  I then asked when we could expect the order and he rudely said "you can choose to work with us or not" and hung up.  I own a restaurant so I get being busy and even making a mistake but own up to it and apologize!! That goes a long way!!  Btw still waiting for the food 1 hour and 45 mins later.
author: Ted H.

description:
Came here for lunch, got a slice of pepperoni, sausage and jalepenos and a medium soda for 5 bucks straight up!  Awesome.  

The pizza had a great crispy crust and the toppings were ample.  After trying a bunch of pizza places around my office, I think I've found the one to go to when I'm craving a slice.  

Guy at the counter was really friendly too!
author: Tu T.

description: Best pizza I've had in the city! Stumbled across this little hidden gem in the heart in the city after a night of hanging out and smoking at a near by hookah place. Staff was amazing forgot to ask for ranch before sliding my card and guess what, they gave the two ranches for free. All there meats are halal and extremely good quality. Pizza was quick and still hot when we got back to our place a few miles away! Price is very reasonable and not expensive at all. You want good pizza check this place out.
author: Mo T.

description: Wonderful freshly made pizza all the way up until closing hours. The mushroom feta pesto pizza was fantastic, and the service was great.
author: Korie M.

description: Just ate a delivery pizza - lukewarm, no flavor, crust looked like heated from frozen, tasted like old bread, pesto sauce was sauceless - dry. Tried this place for their variety but I really wish I had just stuck with Volare Pizza where I have never had a bad order.
author: Patrick M.

description: Pizza is alright, but I started choking on it halfway through and they refused to give me tap water so I wouldn't recommend it...
author: Maresa T.

description: I came with a couple friends after getting a drink at a bar and it was close by for food. My first impression was that the place was kind of dirty (never a great start) and the pizzas looked like they had been sitting out for a while. I ordered one slice of the veggie pizza and that was about $2.50, which for the quality was expensive. They seemed to have pretty standard flavors but i probably won't be back to try them.
author: Kylie B.

description: Pizza is thick crust, ok if you are nearby and don't have a car. It is quick, you just choose from the available pizzas waiting, by the slice.
author: Kelley K.

description: They forgot that I was there, so in the end I got a cold 19$ pizza with me home. Not ok.
author: Thomas E.

description: Best pizza in town! Came here on a whim a while back ago and loved it. Every time I come to San Fran I make sure to come here. So good! You won't regret it.
author: Troy G.

description: I ordered the super deal.... It took an hour and a half when it was suppose to take an hour.... On top of that my order was cold...so i ended up not eating... I left the food on my table and went to sleep.... Way to ruin my night ... Never again... Thanks Milan...
author: Ihab D.

description: My family and I have ordered from Milan several times and we love their pizza. I always ask for the crust slightly lighter, yet done, and they always make it perfect!!!! They also accommodate disabled guests, as my fiancé and I are both in wheelchairs. They even helped us in our paratransit shuttle. Amazing flavors and being in SF, one can pay a grip for a salad. My $6 salad was loaded with spinach, olives, feta, tomato, and for $2.50 I added grilled chicken. I couldn't finish it all. Great pizza shop!!!!!
author: Gwen H.

description:
Almost a year later... second verse, same as the first.

Night out drinking. Brilliant idea to order pizza. Orders an entire pie and two extra slices. And, root beer. Comes back to hotel and shares the pizza with others.

Result: heartburn but not as much regret as last time. For me. I didn't experience a coyote morning. My eating partners, however, were not so lucky.  They experienced: exclamations of private moments (and parts), spilled pie, heartburn (natch), threats of bodily harm, angry texts and e-mails...

It's amazing what this pizza does to people.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Excellent place to eat! The employees were extremely friendly and energetic. To pick a slice or order a whole pizza for delivery it is always the same satisfaction. Check their menu online there are amazing deals that feeds from one person til a whole party. 
Would I return? Of course, without any doubts!
author: Mickael E.

description:
I ordered delivery of a hamburger, medium rare, and a salami sandwich with 8 2-liter bottles of soda for the office.  He delivered and would not take the elevator upstairs, so my co-worker went down to meet him.  He handed her 1 bag and she then went to the elevator.  Apparently, he just left the bag of soda by the front desk.  When I called to tell them I didn't receive the soda, he called me a liar!!!!  Said he had handed to sodas to my co-worker!!!  When we went back down to the front door, the doorman said he just dropped them there and left them.
WARNING - do not order any delivery from them.  The hamburger was well done and like cardboard.  The salami sandwich was good, but definitely not good enough to consider this place again!  I give it one star for the salami.  As a side note - I never give bad reviews on Yelp - this is a first for me.
