The driver and the owner, calling me a liar, infuriated me and prompted me to give this review.
author: Mariel B.

description: Best good we had in San Francisco! They delivered to the Hilton and it was hot and good. Shove that designer food for a hundred bucks where Taco Bell would be better! Thanks guys!
author: Janice F.

description: They have the best pizza ever ..But 1 thing there missing is treating the customer right!! Since then I haven't went back again to that place because his always there and I wouldn't want to be treated bad...there rude and not welcoming!
author: Erica S.

description:
Came here because of the reviews but was thoroughly disappointed
45min to get a pizza when we were told 20min. 
Instead is solving it they blamed us for not hearing the time for prep correctly.  Then the guy yelled at us for wasting his time.
author: Ambi C.

description: Just around the corner from Wilson and Wilson. Pizza is sold by the slice - large slices! Fast and filling for a late night snack after hitting the bars.
author: Sarah G.

description: Good, cheap, greasy, late night,  no frills, hole in the wall pizza joint. I love the atmosphere, the workers are always on their game when the bars close. If the interior or service in this place bothers you,  why are you in the tenderloin in the first place. I go here because I hate fancy, pretentious, over the top fooderies that are too common in many parts of SF
author: Julian C.

description:
I decided to do a review as a thank you for being open on Christmas morning. I'm craving a hot pizza at 2 am on Christmas morning and I wondered if anything will be open and Milan Pizza was open till 3 am and I had an hour to place the order yay!

I ordered the Milan Special because it was the closest thing to a combo pizza and it was ahhhhh sooooo gooooood! It's was spot on and hit the spot. Great price and it arrived in 30 mins despite the operator saying it will be there in 15 mins. I'm like don't they have to cook the stuff? lol

Only minus was the delivery guy. It was fast and abrupt. I said hi he handed my the pizza from his trunk took the money and dash off. I've seen drug deals slower than this. But I'm full now and one happy camper. Merry Christmas y'all.
author: Kent K.

description: Great place to eat when you need a late night snack! Awesome grub! Convenient location and ready to eat quick!
author: Hunter T.

description: Chose this place as a late night delivery based on reviews. Not sure if they were busy or what but got my pizza an hour and half later and it was cold and not worth the wait at all. Flavor wasn't anything fancy unless you like a bunch of dough and poorly cut toppings. Save your money and go to bed or walk somewhere and get what you want.
author: Miss K.

description: You and I both know this place only has business because it is the only place open at 3am. They must make an assload since they were fucking packed and I drunkenly threw all my cash on the counter and said I WANT THIS MANY PIZZAS.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Your standard hole in the wall pizza joint.  Huge, thick slices. Nice customer service.  Super, dirty restaurant if you plan to sit down and dine in.  Just a few tables, chairs and bar stools.  My teenagers gave it five stars on pizza taste!
author: Lance P.

description:
This is a review of delivery from Milan Pizza (San Francisco). I was not very impressed.

Philly Steak Sandwich - the beef had a burnt flavor and was relatively dry. The roll was pretty good. There was very little cheese. The fries were average.

Garlic Bread w/ Melted Cheese - the garlic bread was dry, hard, and cold.

Calzone with Pepperoni, Salami, Mushrooms - the crust was actually pretty nice. The "toppings" were good but there was little cheese. There was not any sauce in the calzone and the side of sauce was a very small amount only filling about half of the small plastic cup.

Delivery was a little long. I consider anything over an hour long. In the case, it was about an hour and twenty minutes. This was 20 minutes past the estimated time. The delivery person was polite and professional.
author: Mark D.

description: crap pizza. one step above cafeteria pizza in school. decent crust. I order 2 single slices. both cheese. I also bought a ¢50 ranch. the ranch was good. pice was a bit high for the quality.
author: Rosemary B.

description: The food has been really good, but they've messed up my orders more than twice.  Other than that, pretty decent pizza for the times I've ordered.
author: Lawree S.

description:
In supporting this establishment you torment the people who live in the building, especially if you eat here between 10PM and 4AM.

DO NOT EAT AT MILAN PIZZA!!!

Since 09/26/2008, there has been an on going noise issue in this building due to a rooftop exhaust system operated by Milan Pizza. A formal complaint was first filed at that time with the San Francisco Department of Public Health (ComplaintID 26588) by a tenant who lives right underneath this exhaust system and has suffered a great deal due to the noise it generates and the fumes it spills into his studio apartment. He is a senior citizen.
 
On May 7th, 2013, Milan Pizza received an Extended Hours Permit through the Entertainment Commission and now on average operates the exhaust system 16-17 hours a day. I only recently found all of this out because in October of 2013, I started to hear a loud clanking and strange humming noise that was keeping me up at night. I live on the third floor and there is still one more floor above me.
 
I filed a complaint with the San Francisco Department of Public Health in February 2014 to help determine what was making the noise. They determined that it was the exhaust system from Milan Pizza responsible for the loud noise. On 03/11/2014, they measured the noise and found that the exhaust system generates a noise of 5.8 dBA above the ambient noise level. This is a clear violation of SFMPC Article 29 Section 2909[a][1]- Residential Property Noise Limits. It states, no person shall produce or allow to be produced by any machine, or device, music or entertainment or any combination of same, on residential property over which the person has ownership or control, a noise level more than 5 dBA above the ambient at any point outside of the property plane. Nowhere in this original article does it state or imply that the noise needs to be created by residential use in order for it to be enforced; the use of the word "any" indicates any and all noise no matter the source. These original limits were set in place to protect the health of the residents living in San Francisco, in any circumstance, from excessive noise.
 
Because the noise is being generated by a business in the basement of the building however, the residents in the four floors above the business are intentionally being denied our right to Quiet Enjoyment of our apartments by being forced to live under noise limits that were originally set forth strictly for commercial property. A  business should only be allowed to operate in a mixed-use building if it is able to adhere to Residential Property Noise Limits. Residential Property Noise Limits exist for a reason and should be safeguarded in mixed-use buildings. Failure to do so creates ghettos and marginalizes people as second-class citizens to businesses simply because the City and County stand to make a profit from taxes. The irony is that the City of San Francisco is simultaneously using two different noise limits in mixed-use buildings. A normal resident such as myself cannot make any noise past 10:00 PM and would be in violation of the Noise Ordinance if I were to make the same amount of noise that Milan Pizza makes at this building. I would be evicted if I did not comply. If the owner of the building ran the exact same exhaust system on the roof instead of Milan, the residents would be able to have the city either make the owner replace the fan so it made less noise or have it removed all together. This double standard is unethical and unnecessarily victimizes the residents.
 
This incessant noise is in violation of the Warranty of Quiet Possession and needs to be resolved immediately. It is unreasonable and cruel for the City and County of San Francisco to force tenants to live this way.
 
Intentionally failing to enforce or misuse the codes that are in place for monetary gain is harmful to the residents of San Francisco.

DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS.
author: Mister E.

description:
Been coming here since they first opened up. Seems like they have built a good customer base here. the pizza is allot better than anything local. 

And by local I mean the tenderloin. 

Slices are hot and packed with plenty of cheese and toppings every time I stop in. Not an ideal place to sit down and eat. Also sometimes you get beggars in there. 

I've had them deliver also plenty of times, and the quality of those pizzas does drop down a bit, but it's still good a pizza for the price. 


This place is still booming and looking forward to it becoming bigger and better
author: sam c.

description: Honestly one of the worst pizza experiences I've ever had. How could you go wrong with pizza?!? Called to get a large pizza with 2 toppings delivered to a friends apartment 1.6 miles away and the guy on the phone told me it would take 45 min to an hour. So an hour goes by and still no pizza. The pizza shows up TWO hours later and it's not even warm!!! Idk wth the guy was doing but a pizza should not take 2 hours andd be lukewarm upon arrival. It took so long my friends and I had given up hope on getting a pizza at all! Did the delivery guy stop by a bar or something? Because that was total bs. Never everrrrr ordering pizza from here again.  I'd give no stars if I could.
author: Jaycee T.

description: I have been here a few times and  this place has friendly staff and the the pizza was amazing. I live in the east bay and drive all the way to SF for their pizza. Keep up the good work
author: Laila R.

description: Order delivery to my hotel. I ordered the hamburger and fries and an order of the cheese sticks and the total only came out to $14. Tastes great and I love that they're open late.
author: Kay C.

description:
Milan Pizza
SF
Friday December 31, 2010
2 Stars

Disclaimer: NYE is never really a good time to judge food.  It was the first place we saw so we ate there.  They just heated up some slices that were sitting out a little to long.  It was cheap: $2.5 for a cheese pizza slice.  The Waterboy with Adam Sander was playing on the TV.
author: Leonard L.

description: This review is on customer service.  Pizza is decent-nothing special.  Asked worker named Oscar a question about the pizza to which he insulted me for asking,  then cussed at me in a vulgar manner which was quite embarrasing in front of other customers.   I will never come back and i will never refer customers to this establishment.   1st rule of business... Never insult your customers!!
author: Mickey T.

description:
I'll give this place benefit of the doubt, maybe I ordered the wrong specialty pizza. I live across from this place so I really want to love it haha

Ordered the San Francisco 12", 6 slices. More than enough for 2 people. $14 pickup. Can't beat that! Ok so maybe the pizza was too meaty.. is that even a thing? Yeah I'll give one of their veggie pizzas a try and do an update. The Greek or Mediterranean maybe. There was nothing wrong with it, just underwhelmed. Qualtiy of the ingredients was good. Crust prob average. I can say though that's it's better than Pizza Hut!
author: Vol T.

description: Literally the worst timing ever. It takes forever for the pizza to get to you through delivery!
author: Breann J.

description: The wings were undercooked and stuck to a sheet of aluminum foil so that when you tried to remove them half the meat stuck to the foil. I'm pretty sure either the wings or the pizza made me sick.
author: Eric E.

description:
As easy as one two three.

One Milan down in the Mission: www.yelp.com/biz/milan-pizza-san-francisco-2#hrid:ugO_0fh4OUTuEs5uOwN9Eg

Two producers to create this classic: www.youtube.com/watch?v=7zqNF9w9ESM

Three stars for a slice of cheese that satisfied the wallet ($2.75) and the stomach (generous in size and quite like the doughy crust everyone else complains about).

Know your Milans. And know your ABCs: www.youtube.com/watch?v=M-aSjHnbw18
author: Jason B.

description: Five stars to this place, friendly workers, Great customer service, delivery always on time. If there were six stars I would give it to this Pizza joint....
author: AbOoud D.

description: Never received my order claimed other customer error. Other customer gave wrong address. Placed order at 0153 called at 0245 told order was out for delivery. Canceled order at 0405. The order was an hour and ten minutes late before eat 24 canceled it. Two hours from placement of order. Apology from eat 24 but no phone call from Milan pizza. Even though brother in law was manager tonight. Thanks
author: shannon w.

description: Amazing place and good service.. their pizza is delicious and their delivery is very fast.. I highly recommend this place to everyone :)
author: Elias A.

description:
Take it to go or for delivery. The place itself is super cramped and furthermore cramped in an iffy spot on Geary.

The pizza: Soft, medium-thickness crust, large cuts sold by the slice, moderate pie size altogether for a reasonable price.

Atmosphere: A couple small tables stuffed in the back, and all the right ingredients that encourage you take your pizza with you.

Try: Pesto pizza

Skip: Mozzarella sticks, too expensive for a bar style snack
author: Taylor S.

description: If you think Blondie's pizza is good, you'll like this. But Blondies is not good, and neither is this. Doughy flavorless crust, undistinguished though slightly spicy tomato sauce, flavorless lowball-quality cheese blend. 2 stars only because if it were the only thing open after a late night I might conceivably eat it.
author: A.J. F.

description: Had the pep and sausage pizza, little too hard on the crust for my liking.  If it's cracker thin, hard is fine but you can't have a half an inch crust that hard and enjoy bite after bite.  Toppings were good but can't enjoy it with a sore jaw from chewing.
author: Matthew M.

description:
SUPER HOLE IN THE WALL

BUT! If I am coming from a comedy show or any late night and need some garlic pesto in my life I will head over to the TL for some entertainment and damn good pizza!
author: Marakia R.

description: Some of the best pizza I have ever tasted.  Absolutely delicious and fresh.
author: Sean D.

description:
As much as I am being a pain and complaining, I am INCREDIBLY ECSTATIC THAT AT 2AM, someone would deliver a pizza to us in the Fillmore.

Yay! Pizza will be here in 45 minutes?! CLAPS IN JOY!

However, it wasn't that great of a pizza. It looks appetizing and feels as if it could be, but in actuality, it is mostly bread. Most of it was heavy starchy bread. Toppings were alright. We went with the salami, pepperoni, and sausage mess. Ingredients were fine, nothing super fresh or noteworthy. It was super cheap though. They are definitely between a 2-3 star right now. Until I find someone else who will deliver to us that late...
author: Winè C.

description: Supper bowl pizza was amazing best pizza I ever had I order the pizza and wings and soda deal , The pizza was fresh and the wings was super good and the staff was super friendly for sure I'm coming back for some more
author: Issac F.

description:
This review is for their delivery on eat24hours.com and they give back cashcoupon!

I've ordered from here a few times already. It's one of the better pizza places on the website. They have a 2+2+2 deal (2 medium, 2 toppings, 2 liter soda) for 20.99. The dough is soft and their crust is a medium thickness. The last order from here was mushroom+artichoke and chicken+bacon (it's canadian) pizzas. The pizzas were both hot and fresh when they arrived. The delivery guy forgot the salad but said he would come back. And he actually did!
author: Binh H.

description:
Came in for a slice late night - probably around 12 or 12:30 AM on Friday November 18th, 2011. Waited a few minutes in line - behind a few drunk customers who appeared to be coming from a club (most of the crowd appeared to be somewhat buzzed) while I was sober.

As I walked up to the counter - a pizza was coming out of the oven with numerous toppings. It appears they bake numerous types of slices on one pie - and then cut it up. I selected the combo slice - and it was immediately plated.

The slice while thick and big; was one of the greasiest slices I have had in my mouth. Cheese didn't stick overally well to the slice and appeared to fall off rather quickly. Found it favorable compared to Rotana - which is around the corner.

Will have to try it buzzed next time.
author: Brian D.

description: The guy in the black hat that works here is really funny, the pizza is hella good and make sure to ask for the online coupon large pizza for $10.99, they don't show it to you up front
author: Sophie Z.

description: I've called Milano Pizza for delivery many times. I like the pizza. But tonite was the worst: Ordered a pizza at 1:45am, told it would be 45 minutes to be delivered. At 2:30 the driver calls to say he's here, but he's not. He's completely lost, total opposite direction. I call him and try to give him directions; the driver is a complete fucking idiot. It's 3:20am and still no pizza....#Fail.
author: Rob R.

description: The guys that work here are great and the pizza is perfect!  If you are looking to have a full belly and be happy from a delightful experience look no further my friend. There are many places to choose from for your pizza needs in this area, but this is THE union square pizza place. If everyone is hungry and you can't decide where to go, then come and stuff yourself with cheesy delicious goodness. You will not be dissapointed!
author: Emily G.

description: Just ordered delivery from here. There were 30 minutes late and refused to provide discount on pizza. Delivery driver refused to get out of car and deliver the pizza. On top of that, the pizza was cold. Never ever never again
author: Darlene G.

description: Good pizza when you've had one too many and the only option is pizza.  Love the texture and taste.  Got the pepperoni with extra sauce!
author: Jay H.

description: decent calzone, but you must get extra marinara for dipping b/c there's no sauce on the zone
author: Sam B.

description:
WOW. Delicious pizza. I had a slice of their mushroom and sausage pizza, and melted. Granted, I had in me a few cocktails thanks to Yelp Drinks and was famished after a busy day of no food, but the taste was pure heaven, clouded judgment or not. Definitely a great place to stop in after a late night carousing around town or simply for a quick fix.

Better service and cleanliness could have lended them a better rating, but hey, it's pizza by the slice for goodness' sakes, so that's arguably unimportant anyway.
author: Amy T.

description:
We went here because our hostel was around the corner and had this place listed on the Late Night restaurants board. The staff was nice enough, and we took our pizza to go. It wasn't that great a pizza, something didn't taste right about the cheese, maybe they use a special blend instead of just mozzarella. We were exhausted from exploring the city though and it was better than nothing.

If I were in the city again, I would go somewhere else for pizza.
author: Monica T.

description: I live across this pizza joint and I definitely consider this a wonderful late-night place to grab some pizza! Pizza is always fresh and warm. Guys are very nice and friendly. Also, I am absolutely addicted to their mozzarella sticks. I am drooling thinking about it right now! Definitely check it out if you are looking for fast, cheap food :)
author: Anna G.

description: Ordered a California pizza for delivery. Took an hour instead of half an hour. Was the most doughy, bread-y, piece of shit pizza ever. Grease seeping through the box. Crust as thick as breadsticks and twice as dry. The meat was old and overcooked. The sauce to cheese ratio was right but everything else completely blowed. Can't believe people like this place. Disgusting.
author: Grayson K.

description: Ordered it from home and it was delicious. Super cheat for city prices and took less than an hour to arrive
author: Brianna P.

description:
I live right around the corner at Tower 737 and order here pretty much 3-4 times a week for these simple reasons:

1. Their mild chicken wings with ranch are to DIE FOR!! 
2. Their delivery time is beyond fast, last time I ordered, it took them 15 minutes exactly to get to my door since I hung up the phone.
3. Their pizza boy Paul is extremely gracious, very engaging, and offers friendly personable customer service
4. Their pizza is not too overpriced in comparison to the astronomical prices found in Nob Hill, and actually pretty decent

Thank you Milan Pizza for feeding me on the daily. Hehe
author: NC B.

description: The best pizza in town so good and yummy . Must try , the staff was great,fresh pizza all day long, delivery was fast too
author: Sultan A.

description: Absolutely disgusting. The dude who works here put our pizza in the oven with his hands which were covered in dirt and pizza dough. The guy was super rude and answered the phone in the middle of taking our order. He also threw his spatula right on top of the dirty counter...gross. Do not recommend for anyone who cares about cleanliness or their health.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo I purchased a $5 voucher on kgbdeals that was supposed to include a slice of pizza and soda. Verbatim "Satisfy your cravings with today's oven-crisped kgbdeal: $2 for a slice of pizza and canned soda at Milan Pizza (worth $5). "

Now, clearly, it does not specify what type of slice. So, I go in thinking I have a $5 credit - cool. I get a ham and pineapple pizza for my other half and produce the voucher. 

"That will be $2." 

Uh................................

Huh?? 

I fork over the $2 and then scrutinize the menu. Now, the menu says $2.50 for a slice of cheese.....each additional item is $.50...so in all my pizza slice, being the two extra toppings, could not have cost more than $3.50....

A can of soda (which was blazing hot because the 'cooler' did anything but that,) was $1.25....


I know I am no mathematician BUT I do know that $3.50 plus $1.25 is undoubtedly under $5...

I also know that there's no way in hell that $2 is going to be the amount on tax.

Obviously, the genius working behind the cash register read my "$2 for a slice and soda" as only $2 worth of credit towards a pizza. 

Maybe before they issue vouchers they should uhm..tell their employees how to handle it?! 

I guess the pizza tasted good so they got a star for that...otherwise they would have definitely only got one star.

BOO TO Malin.
author: Maple S.

description: My card was mistakenly charged $141 for two slices of pizza. When I called to dispute the charges, no one was willing to help me sort out the issue. Terrible service.
author: Meredith M.

description:
Taste:3
Value:3
Cleanliness: 3
Atmosphere:3
Wait time:2
Overall:2
1 being the worst, and 5 being the best


Came here after a late night of partying in sf, its a good place for drunk food, but the place was a bit small. and almost no where to sit. we had to take it to go and eat in the car.

I had a piece of pesto and combo, 
The pesto didnt have much pesto taste or flavor.
the combo was good. I think its about 3.50 a piece. big slices,

the area is cool, I saw some guy smoke a blunt or big cigar and PTFO on the street, that was something new for me after a long night at the club
author: Mike R.

description: The place delivers until 3am, what's not to like about that? I always order their $10.99 large one topping special with pesto. The service is quick and pizza above average.
author: Alice W.

description: I just ordered delivery at around 1 at night.  I must say the delivery was quick and the food was great.  Excellent pizza. Garlic bread could've looked better.  But overall it was great.  I recommend this pizza place.
author: Eric L.

description: Best after-drinking pizza in the area hands down.  A little hardy and just great if you're in the mood for that.
author: Kat S.

description:
ok - it was late and i wanted pizza. like most folk i understand after hour pizza is a toss-up - a gamble, but you go for it anyway - and hope for the best

when the reasonably priced pizza arrived with a cheerful delivery guy, i opened the box to find a handsome looking pizza - crust was just right, golden and charred just a bit - it was hot - and it was crispy! no soggy, bending messy mediocrity, but a flavorful, perfectly fired pizza. 

i just ordered another.
author: John G.

description: This pizza is delicious and always hot. However, their delivery man is apparently afraid of dogs and not only threatened to kick my 5.5 lb pomeranian, but also "shoot her" for barking at his feet. Unacceptable. It's sad because I used to love this place.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Went there the other night for a few slices. Pizza looked good but the meats didn't have flavor and spice very bland.

The worst part was the 'pizza' maker what an attitude. Not a hello, smile or thank you. Then a chick came in and he was her best friend having a great day, etc... what a fake. Then another guy came in and back to a crank.

Will never visit again.
author: Steve D.

description: Great customer service and easy ordering online - they even called to make sure it was good. 45 min delivery, super cheap $ bill but food quality was surprisingly good. Pizza + poppers + garlic bread + x2 deserts + tip = 30 bucks
author: John O.

description:
I was excited about pizza.  I was excited about this pizza.  But then...
Does there always have to be a "but then..."?

See, I'm an EA, which is a pretty way of saying, I'm a secretary that's really, really good at my job.  And amongst my duties - I order food for our every other month staff meeting.

My homeless youth services staff is woefully over-worked and under-paid.  And staff meeting is one of the very...VERY RARE times that they get anything other than a pat on the back for their very hard work.
Let's be clear, we cater a lunch for our staff about 7 times a year.

So, I thought...Pizza...everyone likes pizza.  After calling and getting a busy signal, I hoped online and used their online ordering system...GREAT!  Pizza...ordered...done.  I print off the confirmation and put it in my box of crap for staff meeting tomorrow.

Now, one of the things I've learned in my job is:  you've always got to call.  On the day of a meeting, you call the other party to make sure it's on their calendar or in their book, on a post-it taped to their windshield, written across their forehead...whatever...

On the day that my pizza was supposed to be delivered, I called just after they opened.

"Hey," I said, "I've got an order for 10 pizza's today at 1:30pm.  I just wanted to make sure you had all the info you needed."

The guy said that yea...he had my order.  Great!

So then, I called back at 1:45pm to ask, "hey, my pizzas are late, and I've got a meeting starting in a few minutes for 80 people."  (if you do the math, you'll realize that my catering budget lets me buy them one...count em...one slice of pizza per staff member.)

"Oh," says the guy on the phone who sounded suspiciously like the guy I talked to at noon, "I don't have an order for 10 pizzas."

I look at the confirmation sheet in my hand.

"But I have a confirmation sheet in my hand."
"The online system is down."
"I called two hours ago, and you said you had the order."
"I don't have your order."
"Okay, how fast can you fix this?  What time can I expect my pizza?"
"Um...I have too many orders, so, I can't do it."

So...f**k you, Milan Pizza, there's some social service kharma that's surely gonna come down on your hard.
author: Logan K.

description: Someone from this restaurant illegally entered my apartment building to put their advertisements on everyone's doorknob. STAY OUT OF MY BUILDING. IT'S TRESPASSING.
author: Paul O.

description:
SOOO goood!!
Greasy, but soo yummy!
Not the best spot to dine in at, so delivery is your best bet. 
Wish I still lived in the city to get some more!
author: Viv D.

description: If you think this is good pizza, you 've been seriously missing out. Its a 25% chance that the pizza has correct proportions (to new york pizza, the best american pizza).
author: Rico S.

description: To my tastes, this Palestinian-run, family eatery serves, hands down, the best pizza in the Tenderloin/Tendernob area. And while I do consider it very good quality pizza, typically I'd consider four stars fair enough for what you get, but in this case I just gotta bump it up an extra star for excellent, friendly customer service as well as fair prices ($2.50 for a large cheese slice usually hits the spot for me). As a regular patron I will say that every worker there is honest, positive, hard-working and always there to greet you with a smile. Once I forgot my wallet and Mohammad even trusted me to pay them next time - now how often does that happen in this city, especially in the TL? In my experience, almost never. Keep up the great work gentlemen!
author: John D.

description: pizza was a good size w/great toppings, delivery was semi-prompt
author: Krystal K.

description: I waited 2 hours for a burned sandwich and some lukewarm mozz sticks. Ordering delivery at 1am, I would have been easily impressed. Now I'm just annoyed I had to stay awake for some food I'm well aware was disgusting. Just don't do it.
author: J C.

description: Delicious homemade crust. Can buy by the slice or order what you wish. Friendly speedy service for this local pizza shop. Would recommend for a casual night out or you can order it and they deliver for free!
author: Melissa C.

description: Their pizza's are delicious. It's hard to not make a delicious pizza, but something about their chewy dough I have not found elsewhere. Prices aren't too bad either.
author: Ehtesham K.

description: Good pizza flavor and great late night delivery ... right to our hotel room door in less than 30 minutes.
author: James N.

description:
I live in the hood and this is the best pizza by far. They're also open til bartime, which is very convenient! They always have fresh pies coming out of the oven and keep their work area pretty clean, especially compared to the other pizza spots in the TL. 

It's not fancy, but definitely good enough!
author: Jessi N.

description: Overly doughy, chewey base, very little sauce and gross cheese. Better then nothing in this area, I guess, at 2 a.m.
author: John S.

description:
I've become even more familiar with nocternal eating habits as of late. I blame it on vacation and many a happy hour that turned into hours that turned into "wtf? It's what time?". I've been hanging with friends and Jones is my turning point. Left or right, cute or subtle, decisions are to be made on Geary. If its past the witching hour and I need to pop in some place for a minute to clear my head and fill my belly, I look no further than heading to the Milan of the TL (ha ha).

While this place is handy, its not exactly a destination for late night delights. There's minimal seating inside and your choices for your by the slice purchases will vary. Plus the quality of the pizza is inconsistent in both tasty and texture. But for a food purchase under the five dollar mark its not too shabby. If you're going the full pizza route a small specialty will run you under $20. Plus out of towners I've heard they aren't clueless twits when it comes to ordering for delivery to your hotel. Nothing deserving any over abundant praise but nothing I'd consider a last resort. An aok quick choice past midnight.
author: Veronica G.

description:
Pizza is not bad, but the service is TERRIBLE.

One word answers without explanations. 
Overpriced menu items. 
Dirty bathroom.

If service is important to you, I suggest you go elsewhere.


Would not recommend.
author: Thomas N.

description:
For a late-night pizza place, Milan pizza is great. Comparing it to some of the best pizza i've ever had, I can't say it is in competition. The pizza overall is good though. 

They generally have 5 types of pizza ready for you, some of them I remember are: Hawaiian, meat lovers, pepperoni, cheese, and veggie. I've been there a few times and have tried the first three. The slices are large and filling, and the price is good (I think a couple bucks for a slice). 

The crust is crunchy and they use the right proportion of crust, cheese, and sauce. However, whenever I eat a pizza from here I just feel like it needs more flavor. I'm not quite sure what it is missing but if they figured that part out, they would have one of the best pizzas i've ever had. Maybe it is as simple as some salt...I don't know. 

Milan Pizza is open until 2am I believe, which is great for the late-night bar hoppers getting out of the last bar of the night.
author: Matthew B.

description:
Its OK Pizza not great!  Price was a little...i mean STEEP, however the size of the slice is massive.  Combo slice from Costco is better than here and the price...WHOA!!! and you get a drink, lol!  

Better than Papa JJohn, Pizza Hut and Dominos, but I've had better.

Late-night pizza place is also a good thing.
author: John O.

description:
I picked up a KGB Deals coupon for a slice and pop at Milan Pizza for $2.  I decided to head over for lunch yesterday with my coupon in tow.

The guy behind the cash could use a lesson in being a bit more friendly and service-oriented but the pizza was definitely worth the trip there.  The slices are a bit small in comparison with other slice places I've been to but the price is quite a bit lower as well.  They had a few flavours to choose from, I decided to stay simple and go with the cheese pizza.  

Lots of cheese, a good amount of sauce, it was definitely a very tasty lunch.  Not a lot of pop selection I found, but I was happy with the blue raspberry crush (I've never seen that flavour before!)

Not a bad place to grab a quick lunch when you're on the run.  And the coupon definitely made it worth it!  Would happily go back to pay regular price for a slice of pizza and drink!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I recently had a terrible customer service experience here.
It was weird because they are usually so nice here.  Was it different because I came in with guys?
Anyways, came in here with my boyfriend and another friend.  The pizza guys spent 5 minutes talking to and flirting with an extremely intoxicated tourist.  It was really frustrating because they literally ignored us for way too long.  We are regular customers and really didn't appreciate this level of unprofessionalism.  
I really like the food here, but I haven't been back since.
author: Jannea T.

description:
I have eaten my fair share of slices from cities around the world, and it always surprised me how lacking SF pizza was.  Mr. Pizzaman and Pronto being the staple late night deliveries.. Once you put the bong down, you realize.. this stuff tastes like crap.

I finally came to my senses and moved to the TL.. and found Milan pizza on my way home from work one night.  Oh my gosh, this is the best pizza I have had since NYC or Chicago.. Finally someone is getting it right in the neighborhood.  Mystic treated me well for many years, but I don't find myself in Lower Haight that much any more.. Milan delivers fast and hot.. Good stuff
author: John D.

description: Morons bring 3.5 star bs. I'm eating this pizza at Clift and people are giving 5 star envious looks. My mouth says 5 stars. Girlfriend says 5 stars. Peace.
author: Jason L.

description:
I visited here over this past weekend.  It was one of the only places open near our hotel late Saturday night.  We were starving so we decided to give it a try.  

The pizza - was surprisingly good!  Crispy crust and flavorful.  I got something with Basil pesto and tomatoes... tasty!  The slices were of generous size also.  

Service was really nice too.  Very friendly for it being so busy and late at night.  

We got some mozzarella sticks to go and unfortunately passed out in the hotel room before we got to try them.  However, we did eat them the next morning cold and it was still pretty delicious.
author: Nikki M.

description: Very average pizza :( and when I say a pizza place is average that is not a good thing.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Good! my usual stop over after a night of a few drinks in the city... I discovered it while squintily-eyed looking for a place to eat after Rye (or was it Ambassador...), and found a place that has cheese that is thicker than the crust!

Not a bad deal at all, and the slices are on the bigger side so the grease can help absorb that extra drink that you wish you didn't have so you could drive home. A good balance to a great night
author: James A.

description: Milan Pizza is tough for me because the pizza is actually decent. If I were grading the pizza alone I would give them 3 or 4 stars. But, when you order a pizza there is far more involved than just crust, sauce, cheese and toppings. You also want your order to be correct, you want your pizza to be delivered in a reasonable amount of time and you want the people you interact with to be reasonably friendly. It was in these latter aspects that Milan fails. In most cases it takes them an hour to make a delivery, I consider that reasonable. However, about one third of the time it takes them 2-3 hours. I've had my order incorrect more often than not. For example, in a recent order that was placed through Eat24, I ordered a pizza, wings, and a soda. Instead, I received a pizza, salad and a similar (but not exact) soda. Thinking I had received someone else's order I contacted Eat24 who contacted the store. Milan said they would send the wings out, they had just messed up. Three hours later, wings arrive. The delivery driver immediately gets an attitude and keeps repeating he delivered a salad. That's true, he did. But it's also true that's not what was ordered. That is fairy typical of Milan: You will consider ordering from there because the pizza is good, but eventually they will mess up your order one too many times, they will be rude once too much and you will refuse to do business with them any longer.
author: Justin H.

description:
Milan Pizza deserves five stars in my book, and my book is the one that matters, so why am I only giving them four stars?  Well, I break my own obsessively crafted and revised Yelp rules all the time, and I give plenty of businesses five stars when really they only deserve four, but pizza is another category altogether.  My pizza reviews are bigger than me (insert pun here), and so I feel especially conscientious about getting the star level correct.

OK, story time.

Remember Our Friend?  You don't?  Why, he's the guy who used to own Divisadero Farmers Market, the non-farmers market farmers market on Divisadero, silly.  Well, his three main employees were Rafik, who now works at Rose Food Mart in the Mission, another guy who's now a limo driver, and Ahmad.

Why is this relevant?  Well, because I've run into all three of these characters in other places in SF.  First, it was Rafik.  I've already written enough about him in my Rose Food Mart review.  Soon after reconnecting with Rafik, I saw the other guy standing in front of his limo outside of Divisadero Farmers Market.  I asked him how he was doing, and he said all right.  He randomly asked about Rafik, and I told him I had actually run into him.

OK, here's where it gets better.  The same night I saw the other guy, I ordered pizza from Milan Pizza for the first time.  When the delivery guy showed up, it was Ahmad, the third guy who used to work for Our Friend.  He asked how I was doing, and we talked about Rafik and the other guy.

I've ordered pizza from Milan Pizza a bunch of times, and almost every time, Ahmad has been my delivery guy.  He's always really friendly, and he tells me how things are going.  His cousin, who also works at Milan Pizza, takes the orders over the phone, and his voice is very similar to Ahmad's.  For a long time, I thought the guy on the phone was Ahmad, but I had a surreal experience of talking to that guy on the phone (I was calling to find out when my pizza was coming) and seeing Ahmad get out of his car.  It freaked me out for a second because I wanted to say, "It's OK, Ahmad; Ahmad just got here."

(Cool.  Lightning in San Francisco.  So rare and beautiful.  Tuesday, January 19, 2010, 3 p.m.)

The pizza itself is really solid.  It's not amazing, but it's consistent, and the toppings are fresh.  They have some pretty good deals on their website.  The more often you order from them, the quicker their service.  I believe this is because Ahmad specifically visits me first when he has multiple deliveries to make on one run.

OK, I lied in the beginning of this review.  Five stars it is.  I'm such a softy.
author: John S.

description: Don't you dare get pizza from here. I was really disappointment at how tasteless it is. NO salt whatsoever was added. Ordered the "vienna" and they dumped or rather majorly sprinkled that pizza with garlic as if they had no other ingredients. C'mon now. A pizza is supposed to be tasty and ready to give some kinda sensation when in the mouth. With this one, took a bite quickly swallowed and started adding salt to the rest. Wanted to give 'em a 1 star but don't wanna be too harsh. I believe they can improve ;).
author: DeesQue N.

description: OK pizza.  HORRIBLE service. We waited 45 minutes for a pizza because they burned it the first time. Fine. Mistakes happen. At least offer a drink while we wait. When this mediocre pizza finally arrived,  the guy sat it down on the table and could not get away from our table fast enough. It was as if the presence of dissatisfied customers made them uncomfortable so they handled it by ignoring us. The nerve of us. Also, they looked like they might have roaches. Find some where else to eat.
author: Michelle M.

description: In town for the week and decided to order a late night meal after hitting the town. This pizza joint seemed legit so I ordered. Long story short I didn't realize the hotel won't let people in unless they have your full info so we didn't get our pizza. I call today and they were kind enough to make another pizza and deliver it to us. Let me tell you. It was worth the wait. The dough was thin and crispy. The cheese was amazing. The sauce had a nice kick to it. The best pizza I've had in quite some time. I'm giving them 5 stars for their amazing customer service and delicious pizza. Yum!!!!!
author: Nando C.

description:
If it's late at night, you're starving, just happen to be walking by here and the only type of food you want is pizza this might be the place for you. Otherwise, go elsewhere. 

My pizza was average and nothing more. I've had worse and I've bought a frozen pizza that has been better.
author: Steve B.

description: Made the mistake of ordering from here a second time. Whoever thinks this is good pizza has no idea what a pizza should taste like. Its too chewy anf bland. The ingredients they use are of inferior quality. Even the sides i order, jalapeno poppers and wings were terrible. Please do yourself a favor and order from somewhere else.
author: Bharat B.

description: Pepperoni pizza delivered at midnight to our hotel room.  Good price, very convenient, and tasty pizza that was also good as a cold breakfast the next day.
author: Marianna K.

description:
I live next door to this place and glad i do! great pizza, good prices, never a long wait, open basically all the time. not much more i can say. reasons for not giving the fifth star? SOMETIMES the pizzas are inconsistent, they either taste "best" or "very good". never close to "average" though. also, sometimes when i walk by i notice only one or two pizzas ready. i assume the rest arent far away though, so no big deal. i dont care that theres only enough room for a small child inside the place (5 seats max) cos im always on my way home anyway. 

just to throw a bit more praise at Milan, its one of the only places i will or want to order a strictly vegetarian pizza. even without meat on it, the amount of vegetables and cheese are yummm-eeee!!
author: Shariya A.

description:
halloween weekend, 3 am - my friends and i were hongray!! thank goodness we could count on milan pizza!

these owners are smart. i bet they make a lot of good money off drunken food deliveries on the weekends. even better? it's easy to meet the minimum delivery fee (basically you just have to order a medium or large pizza, which corresponds to about 10-12 slices). the extra perk is that the pizza is actually something i'd eat sober - it's delicious without swimming in grease/lord knows what else.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Today, almost a year after my first review, someone commented to say that "Rush Hour to Treasure Island has no guarantee" and "if they make a mistake they will fix it". 

I want to again reiterate that my initial order was placed at 8:30 PM which is by NO DEFINITION rush hour and at almost 1 O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING , they  still hadn't fixed the order or offered any acceptable remedy, brought a cold pizza, and didn't bring the entire order.

Mahmood, if you'd like to sell your business as being customer oriented, respond prior to a year after the fact and don't ignore the facts of the situation. Moreover, if you want to say that "Treasure Island delivery isn't guaranteed", you should do so at the time of the order and only during rush hour. And perhaps you should look into what "rush hour" is defined as because it isn't after 9PM.

You should also be aware of things such as "google maps" and "traffic.com" that allow people to look at traffic in the city and on the bridge so they can know quite clearly if you botched their order (like you did with us) or just hit traffic (which you didn't since we had 2 different guests arrive in 2 different vehicles over the course of our 4 hour pizza debacle. And, yes, one of them was kind enough to bring us dinner).
author: Max A.

description: Great small pizza joint.  Large slices for $3.50.
author: Kevin W.

description: The best pizza in san francisco,  the employees there are super friendly and funny, the place is very clean , thier health score is 100, i order a delivery  last night and it came within 25 minutes  and it was still so hot, they have a variety choices of appetizers and dessert, and a wide selection of sodas..... im a regular here and i live it , thumbs up to milan the best!!!!!!!!!
author: Will H.

description: I ordered delivery tonight from here...I live one block down on o'farrell so you could walk to my place. I get a call an hour after ordering from some guy Imcan barely understand telling me to come downstairs. Ive got a foot injury which is why I ordered delivery in the first place so this defeated the whole purpose...plus Ive never had anyone refuse to deliver food to my apartment. The guy called me again because I wasnt moving fast enough for him so I checked him and told hime he needed to cool his heels. When I got downstairs this guy was pulling my food out of the dirty trunk of his car. I told him Id never had such poor delivery service and he had the nerve to give me attitude. I hope he enjoys eating that pizza. Ive eaten here for years but Ill never spend any money with this business again.
author: Michael G.

description: It's one of the better cheap pizza palaces in the area, but it can be a bit shady at times.  For some reason they have a bunch of guys hanging around who are "working" but not really doing anything.  One time I called in an order and they totally forgot that I had placed the order.
author: Mike D.

description: If you're looking for a good slice of pizza in the area, Milan is a solid choice. You'd probably give it 4-5 stars if you were drunk. But I was sober, and I'd only come here if I was in the area or looking for a drunken 4th meal.
author: Monelle A.

description:
After coming here several times a week, every week, pretty much ever since I moved to the 'hood--LITERALLY, I can't help but write an update. This is the bf's go-to spot whenever we're at my place, or when I'm on my way to his place...

The bf: "Shaybee, can you get me pizza??? You know what I like!"
 
Me: "Yes, I know [along with all the guys who work there---pepperoni and sausage and a combo slice--the usual (both for $7)]...how many slices? Two...okay...see you soon..." *CLICK (not that phones actually make "click" noises anymore--that was so the '90s)* 

Once, I came in alone and owner knew who I was picking up for and told me to tell my bf that he's lazy! As if I didn't already know this...I love these guys--I wonder if anyone else comes in as much as we do? Things I try not to think about...don't judge!
author: Kristine W.

description:
Rodney King here with your triple play by play,

layin it down like peperoni, pineappz and jalepeno!
3 Bros, hookin it up, Vin Diesel rippin up fast and the furious 3,
finished with red pepper flakes, parmesan and a weird memory of passing out on Geary st after an all night San Pelligrino binge.

decently delicious pizza with a one two three times a lady in the makin.
author: rodney k.

description:
Conveniently close to Rye, Swig, Ambassador, and most importantly, home, I've come here often enough that it feels like a Sex and the City Miranda/Chinese restaurant moment where the staff knows exactly what I'm going to order before I even open my mouth to ask. 

Over the months their pizza has improved. I'm usually not a fan of thick crust, but theirs has a delicious bread-like taste, mixed each day in that huge monolith of a Kitchenaid standmixer in the back room. Slices are large and toppings are generous, but not so overwhelming that it sinks the slice like the Titanic when I hold it in one hand. Just one slice and I'm satisfied with a full tummy and the nostalgia of all those late night noshings a certain stressed out college kid used to do on midterm nights. And considering the amount of OT hours I've been racking up lately, I've become quite a regular here. 

I usually ask for the veggie pizza slice, add chicken, and I love how it doesn't taste greasy. Depending on who completes my order, I sometimes get an additional sprinkling of cheese on top, and they'll always give it a quick pop in the oven to re-warm it and make sure the bottom stays crunchy. 

In addition, the guys that run the place are always extra nice to me. From what I've seen they've been very accommodating to picky pizza eaters wanting their slices done a certain way, but get confused easily when someone orders an item others rarely pick (like the antipasto salad). 

5 stars, although I haven't tried their delivery services yet.
author: ChiYan T.

description:
This is one of my tried-and-true pizza places in the city. Of course, I haven't tried too many others, but out of what few I have I keep coming back to Milan. I've only been inside a couple of times, and nowadays I only order for delivery. I always get the Greek Special, and it's always the same Greek Special yum that it was before. They get to me within the allotted amount of time, and the delivery guys are always polite.

I've also tried their mozzarella sticks and french fries, which, separately, are pretty friggin delicious for mozzarella sticks and french fries. Eaten together, however, they may or may not create 'splosions in your gut of the painful variety, because they are the fried foods that they are.

In any case, they're pretty good and it probably won't hurt you to try them. They serve some yummy foods.
author: Holly F.

description: As another reviewer posted I wish I could give ZERO stars.  DO NOT GO TO THIS PIZZA PLACE.  I ordered two slices, one was fresh out of the oven but was very thick, doughey, oily, and overall just NOT GOOD PIZZA.  What made this place ZERO stars was the 2nd piece i ordered.  It had been sitting out for who knows how long so they placed it into the over to re-heat.  DID nothing and when I got home (had ordered pizza to go) the piece was COLD and cheese was hard.  The was the pizza nasty piping hot, imagine how it tasted as i attempted to eat it cold.  SICK.  Threw both slices away.  Should of known by looking at the pieces through the glass.  If you like thick, oily, flavorless, pizza, go here.  If not, please go somewhere else.
author: Russell K.

description:
Reading the one-star reviews of Milan is like reading the 1-star reviews of Vessel coming from people who tried to get in at 11:30 on a Saturday night.

Please try and put things in perspective before you Yelp, OK people?

Milan offers the finest pizza by the slice in all of the Tenderloin.  How am I qualified to make this call?  Two simple reasons:

1) I have, actually, visited every PBS place in the TL
2) Each one was visited while sober

The slices are large and competitively priced ($2.50 for cheese) with a  solid crust, just the right amount of cheese, and my favorite part - their sauce which has a nicely tangyness to it without being overwhelming.  To top it off, the guys running it are friendly.  

So whether your sober or drunk, starving or moderately hungry, look no further than Milan.  It's worth walking the couple blocks and dealing with the sketchy characters on the block.
author: John H.

description: Good food but shitty service they were speaking Arabic talking shit and I speak Arabic and absolutely hate when people do that! If you want good food grab and go!! Worst service alive
author: Sam E.

description: Really great pizza! Loved it. Got a supreme pizza to go and it was about as good as a pizza can get. Reasonably priced & friendly service too!
author: Martha H.

description: I have been here a couple times now and ive yet to be impressed, but it's cheap and im usually wasted. I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you've had a lot to drink.
author: Anthony C.

description:
the pizza is decent for how late its open for delivery (3am a lot of the time)

but it's not great
author: Belito L.

description:
Just finished my pizza and I'm pleasantly surprised! 

I got a 3 topping (garlic, peperoni and spinach) medium pizza, garden salad and 2 sodas for $17. 

The delivery guy was fast and my pizza was piping hot. The salad is big and fresh too. I was leary of the light orange tomatos, but they tasted amazing and figured, I'd rather have tasty tomatoes than pretty ones. 

I'm not sure what they call a medium, because I'm pretty sure I consider what they gave me to be a large pizza. They were generous on the toppings too. 

The only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is that their crust is nothing to write home about. While the sauce and ingredients are delish, the bread was just there--not good not bad just bread. 

I would recommend them again adn now I have tons of left overs! It was a large portion of food. I expected smaller--happy surprise.
author: Desiree P.

description: Late night and hungry for what I was reading was fast delivery. The guy could barely speak or understand what I was saying which became redundant and nerve racking. I hate repeating myself more than 10 times in an order need I mention about 20. Never again there are always other options. Then I hang up after not finishing the order and they still have the nerve to deliver. Business must be bad for them. He keeps banging and waiting outside my room for like 15 minutes. GO AWAY...... Desperate for a quick buck I was gonna give him a tip for effort but he was off the chain annoying.
author: Jen L.

description: The most discusting pizza ever!!!!!! Could not even finish the one slice. Greasy, and ingredients were definitely not fresh. HORRIBLE!!!!!!! I wish i could give zero stars.
author: M D.

description: hey, i love this place! The guys at the register are awsome, very nice friendly guys. Usually there is a comedy on the TV set near the register, so there is always something to look at while waiting for your pizza. I usually take out, and am always satisfied with my thick delicious slice and its reasonable price.
author: Nathan Anthony R.

description: One star because of their service, and for ripping me off.  I spent $2 through KGB for a $5 voucher for a slice of pizza and a can soda. They gave me fountain soda instead, but that's not a big deal to me. But then, they said to pay $2. I was like, what...I already paid for the $5 voucher online. Why should i pay another $2. They wouldn't budge. Rip off! I plan to use that coupon again to get the most from my purchase!  They're not honoring the voucher the way it should.
author: Logan Y.

description: Pizza was okay if anything. I enjoyed the toppings, the problem was that the crust was to chewy and it had more of a loaf taste too it. The mild buffalo wings lacked flavor. Taste was something out of a Chinese restaurant. Will try out the other pizza parlors in the area. Hope is not lost
author: Hugo T.

description: after recently coming in from a long flight from Ft. Laud and a couple delicious cocktails at B&B, BF and I were famished and a wee bit too tipsy to get behind the wheel. Milan Pizza the rescue, huge slices, awesome crust, great sauce which make or break a pizza in my book. one lil thing is i noticed they used canned mushrooms which is a big no no but cant complain about any of the other veggies. + a couple waters and we were as good as new! wahoo!
author: Monika K.

description: This place serves the best pizza I've eaten in my entire life. You can get a specialty huge slice of pizza with a generous amount of toppings for only $3.50. Highly recommend everyone to eat here at least once.
author: Brittany B.

description: We got a pepperoni pizza tonight, on Christmas. They were open which was amazing, but they delivered to our hotel room and the pizza was fantastic!
author: Deborah M.

description:
Pretty decent pizza, i live close by and its really convenient for me to just go grab a pizza after drinking, BOOZE AND PIZZA, without it, life has no meaning, I kid. 

The slices are pretty big, the place is really hot inside, i sorta almost feel bad for the guys that work there.  The skinny lanky gentlemen that works there is pretty humorous and nice, i always leave with a smile. 

i'd definitely come here again.

oh yeah, they only have a few seatings and a bar type stool area. they take credit card but charge a couple of cent.
author: Tam T.

description: You can always count on Milan Pizza to be open for late night eats!  I came here after a night out and got 2 huge slices of the combo for $7...it was so gooood!  For the price, hours, and level of yum factor...it gets a 5 stars!
author: Sandy L.

description:
Great place to come grab a slice after the clubs. My second time here and I have no complaints.

The guys who work here are very friendly and nice. Milan offters HUGE slices of pizza for $3.50 and they are piping hot, fresh out of the oven, cheesy goodness, loaded with chunks of toppings. YUMMO!

Caution: Watch out for homeless guys who say they're hungry and you give them the best part of the pizza (the crusty part) and they toss it on the floor right in front of you! =(
author: Ling H.

description:
Big slices, friendly guys who work there.
Open really late.
author: timothy h.

description: It's alright if you need something late night and quick. Crust could be better.
author: Jay L.

description: I eat walk-in pizza because i work across the street, I've never tried the delivery, but I can say that the pizza when i get there is always fresh and delicious, its my favorite in the entire Tender-Knob region, and the guys are all real friendly (maybe because by now they know my face!)
author: Shen T.

description:
I wish i could give this place zero stars.
Pizza meh.
The people that work there...well lets just say i think the pizza has a higher IQ and understanding of how to run a business. 
Basically just don't even bother trying to order a pizza, just walk your fat ass over there and throw your money away.
author: Austin F.

description:
This pizza is like a good 40 of Steel Reserve Malt liquor.  A slice of supreme is cheap (3.50 for a HUGE thick slice loaded with cheap toppings), and you know it's gonna make you feel good.

Unfortunately as I'm chowing down on a greasy slice, it reminds me of those alka seltzer commercials where they show the loaded welfare cheese nachos and 19 chili dogs.

Just like the 40oz, the chili dogs, or the nachos, the aftermath of this ain't gonna be good.
author: Rocco B.

description: Excellent pizza - made New York style. Service is friendly and fast.
author: Lei P.

description: Great pizza at a little dive restaurant. We are from NY so we know good pizza and this pizza is good! I had the pepperoni and olive slice and it was delicious.  The crust is good and the dough is thick.  Sauce is perfect. Would definitely recommend this pizza to anyone who wants a good slice without the ambiance.
author: Gina B.

description: Sataurday Night! YEP the best slicessssss
author: Zohan E.

description:
Ok. Here are some things that you should know about me:

1. Not really a fan of pesto (don't know why because I love all the ingredients...but seperately)

2. I don't usually eat the crusts on my pizza, esp thick crusts. 

But there's something about this place that made me change my ways. When it comes to pizza, I'm as vanilla as can be (nothing makes me happier than a slice of ooey-gooey cheese) but when my cheese wasn't available, I settled on their pesto, tomato and spinach slice and you know what? it was GOOOOOOD. And I killed that shit, crust and all. Maybe it was the alcohol I had previously but I'm pretty sure I'd like this with or without the champagne.
author: kristin e.

description:
9/4/08 road bike training:
duration - 01:33:37 (hh:mm:ss)
distance - 19.6 miles
calories - 1,241 cal
heart rate high - 175 bpm
heart rate average - 147 bpm
heart rate low - 117 bpm
speed avg - 14.8 mph
speed max - 35.5 mph
cadence avg - 77 rpm
cadence max - 114 rpm

past six days of recovery and break from biking...trip to los angeles....and back to day one of training....with stats above....returning back and a sign from above....a milan pizza flyer....pizza after training?....oh heck yeah!....beauty of biking....able to eat and eat.....quick order of large special pizza, buffalo wings and 2 liter pepsi soda.....fairly quick delivery experienced....total $26.03..handing $30 total for food and tip.....

buffalo wings and ranch....different in that buffalo wings lightly breaded and deep fried....still spicy, but crunchy....enjoying fried chicken wings...not really buffalo....just spicy crunchy.....(second order and buffalo wings battered and fried...less crunchy experienced...totally different wings)....open of pizza box...and surprising thick chewy crust....thick crusted pizza...good to replenish carbs....loving thick pepporoni slicing and mounds of crumbled sausage....enough cheese to please....fine meal...two slices and full....filling and a bargain meal....order from milan in future....
author: Hen A.

description: yayyy drunk pizzaaaa!!!! i mean really if you're not drunk and looking for some munchies post the TL bars you probably don't need to be going to Milan pizza but if you are in that particular situation it's quite good, at least until the morning.
author: Misha T.

description:
Food: The best by-the-slice pizza I've ever had.  The dough is perfectly baked so it's a little crispy on the outside and very soft on the inside. They are very generous with the toppings. The cheese is perfectly melted, not sloppy or dry.

Price: $3.50 gets you a very large and filling pizza slice with a lot of toppings.  They have a stupid $10 rule on credit cards but the pizza more than makes up for it.

Space/Service: The space is small, you're better off with delivery/take-out.  The service is quick and friendly.
author: Mack D.

description: Amazing place, cheap delicious pizza, its hott and all you need is exact change. The guys are cool dudes, i've never felt uncomfortable, they give you a box for your slice and they warm it up for you. It worth the stop. I always get Pepperoni for about 3.50, worth it, its delicious. Pick up 2 slices, one for today and microwave the next one tomorrow! great lunch also, it fills you up and the slices are huge! Nice little gem.
author: Kat A.

description: The pizza is good...and they are open really late!  THere's nothing like pizza at 4am after a long night of dancing!
author: Robin G.

description: No handwashing here.  I wish I could write a more in depth review, but that is all I have to say.  They don't wash the paws before working with your pizza dough.  The pizza was not really great.  It was okay, and next to our hotel.
author: Alex S.

description: Best cheap and fast pizza I have seen so far on my route back from work!
author: Aditya M.

description: Nothing beats late night cravings like a hot slice of mushroom pizza.  And Milan's makes one that will fill you up and satisfy you.
author: F. P.

description:
They brought some of this crap to work for a working lunch...so bad.  I am usually a fan on NY style thin crust plain...just cheese.  Anyway, so the fiancee got us some little star with toppings last week.  I had to admit pretty good with toppings.  This pizza was near crap.  Lots of toppings, if you're into that, but very little flavor, oily, and a little too doughy.

Bah...won't be back...pizza ain't that tough, I'll go elsewhere
author: Aberdo G.

description: pizza was good, hours were good, but place was compacted, dirty and needs a good scrub down.
author: Brandy H.

description: Would have really enjoyed my cheesesteak and fries, but they used so much black pepper on the sandwich and the fries!  I think the sandwich would have been pretty good based on the ingredients, but I actually hate black pepper and never use it as a seasoning.  So, in every bite of my sandwich, all I could taste (and see) was black pepper.  I was able to dig down below and find a few fries that weren't completely covered in pepper, but not many.  If you love black pepper on your food, you'll like this place!  If not, be sure to ask them to hold the pepper.  I would have done that had I known they use it so heavily.  I view pepper as something that most places leave as an option, maybe including packets with your order.  Had the food delivered, so I wasn't able to ask for another order.  I left most of my food untouched.  What a waste!
author: Cara P.

description: I order a cheese pizza and they never delivered it?? I tried calling back and there phone was busy.
author: Steve V.

description: Not the best, but it's convenient. Really doughy crust which is good in my opinion but sort of lacking flavor. Overall it's good in a jam. We spent some time here waiting for some friends of ours. There is usually a soccer game playing with a crowd watching intently. The interior is nothing special but it is something to write about. As we were sitting there, you could hear water dropping slowly into a bucket. The bucket was by the cash register. A little while later the crack in the ceiling started letting more water through, almost as if the source above had a reason to let more water out (a shower, a toilet, etc are all that came to mind). Sadly we saw this as we left :(
author: Greg G.

description: These guys are awesome. Had a late night craving for pizza and looked them up.  I'm in town on vacation and had them deliver it to my hotel.  Ordered a pepperoni pizza and chicken wings for under $20. Only thing I wish was for the pizza to be hotter on delivery but I can't really complain. They are pretty quick on delivery too. Got here in less that 40 minutes.
author: Siegfried A.

description: Was walking from a bar to my hotel late one night when I wanted some food to supplement the early dinner that I had eaten.  For no real reason other than because it was nearby, we chose this place.  The best thing about having no expectations is that there can be pleasant surprises.  The pizza was warm and the pepperoni wasn't the cheap stuff that a lot of places use.  There was copious amounts of cheese on the crust and... need anything more be said?  Lots of cheese!!!!
author: Lucius M.

description: Awesome pizza after a night of drinking and puking. Thank goodness for my girlfriends for not listening to me that night. I was wasted as usual on our first bachelorette party night. Friends would not get me my onion rings from Mel's Diner so after 3 rounds in the bathroom, I finally came to my senses and ate a slice of this beautiful pizza. It was tasty alright. Credit to Milan for making me feel better with its greasy goodness but the pizza was actually even better a day old.
author: Joy C.

description: I just ate here,yesterday night..I think it was a quite delicious pizza..and the slices were big enough to make you full..i think i will go there again..
author: mert k.

description: Good pizza if you live around the area. Be aware that they charge .75 cents for credit card purchases under ten dollars. Pizza is nothing special, but good if you're a student or drunk hostel-goer in the area.
author: Will A.

description: First, they took an hour and 15 minutes to deliver after quoting 30-45 min (strike 1).  Then they delivered the wrong pizza (strike 2).  The wings tasted like they came from a frozen tyson bag (strike 3).  Horrible.  The pizza was ok itself.  Just not impressed.
author: JD H.

description: WORST DELIVERY EVERY!!!! They are VERY rude on the phone and just straight out lied both times on the phone when we were trying to figure out how long it would take! They didn't even bother to apologize or compensate for the inconvenience and the rudeness. What a great experience for using them the first/last time. If you're hungry and you want to order in, DO NOT go with this place.
author: Lo L.

description: Great pizza! Delivered at 2am during our visit to San Francisco
author: Felipe b.

description: I was looking for just a slice of pizza and I found the perfect place! The pizza was delish and the slices are huge! I ordered 2 slices and couldn't finish it all. It was reasonably priced and the service was great. I liked that they had some seating inside too.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
We ordered a pizza at 8pm. At 9:15 we called to see why it wasn't here and were told that the delivery guy locked his keys in his car and that the pizza would be here in a half hour. Were they going to bother to call and tell us this? 
It is now 10:30 and we still don't have a pizza. If it actually shows up and is the greatest pizza I've ever had, I'll update my review. But I doubt it.
author: J S.

description: Fantastic salads and pizza!  The owner and manager and very generous and help out good causes.  Delicious pizza.  The cheese melts in your mouth.
author: Joe G.

description: Ordered this pizza for delivery recently. The man who answered the phone was cheery and friendly, which was a good first impression. There were lots of good coupons on their menu and website. The pizza came quickly (25 minutes-ish?) and was VERY tasty! Thick crust, tons of cheese...delicious! I have a couple favorite pizza places in the city, but I think this will start to join the rotation more frequently!
author: Anne A.

description: I really wanted to like this place because it's convenient for me, but as other reviewers have said, the crust is too thick and doughy. I ordered a slice of the pesto. I ate it because I was starving after work, but it tasted mediocre at best. Also, FYI, bring cash. There's a 75 cent charge if you use a credit card for a purchase under $10.
author: Catherine C.

description: Good pizza and great guys! Big slices, great toppings and pretty fresh! Debit/credit $10 minimum keeps this from 4 stars - one $3.50 slice is enough! Coke and a slice, guy!
author: Josh M.

description: chill place, they let us bring our beer in. get the roast beef sandwich.
author: Marina M.

description:
So, I have gone to this place a couple of times.  It is right around the corner, and honestly the pizza is really really good.

However, last night I decided to get a slice after a late night of working.  A plain cheese slice I should say.  So I go home and go to bed.

In the middle of the night I wake up, my head is spinning.  I try to stand up, but can't at all.  I fall into the wall.  Equilibrium all off.  I can't look at anything, because its just spinning and shaking.  I have to close my eyes.  I climb back into bed and try hard not to move, or else I will lose my mind, and hopefully not throw up, because there is no way I can make it to the bathroom.

Somehow I fall back asleep, and wake up in the morning.  Hoping it was a bad dream.  Nope.  Still the same: can't move, stomach hurts, can't see anything clearly, head spinnning, want to vomit, but can't get anywhere.

I have NEVER had food poisoning like this before.  It is late in the afternoon and only now I can start to see clearly a bit....good enough to write this damn review.  I know it is this place because I had barely ate anything at all yesterday.  Must be their old moldy cheese.

This is horrible.  

No matter how much that I think their pizza is delicious, I can not take the risk of this happening to me again.  Not going to go back.  This is horrible....
author: Ryan W.

description:
This place is the entire reason that my awful night was somewhat salvaged.  The massive(ly annoying) crowds at Ambassador had me so mad I decided I was going to leave... alone.

Not a great idea in this area of town at night, you know?!

After circling the block a few times, I decided that maybe some pizza would cheer me up.  And it totally did the trick.  A nice warm slice of pepperoni with crushed red pepper.  I sat there with my BlackBerry and read Lance Armstrong's tweets from the Tour de France, eating pizza, and helping inebriated people dispense water from the cooler next to me.

Not too greasy and total comfort food exactly when I needed it.  The workers were so efficient and friendly.  They also had gelato.  Just the fact that it was there in case I needed some mint-chip was uber comforting.  A neighborhood gem for the people who need a time out of Swig, Ambassador, and the other local establishments.  

But not sure I would frequent this place in the daytime ;-)

Four stars at night after a couple of cocktails.  Unrated when the sun is still out.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Late night pizza tastes so good! I thought maybe it was good because I was a bit buzzed, but I had saved some for the next day and reheated it, still good! Tried the combination and the tomato pesto, all very good. The crust was crisp and soft on the inside and the cheese was oozing with lots of toppings. Big slice for a small price! Extra stars goes out to the friendly and accommodating staff there.
author: Karen L.

description: Delicious!  Today we decided to try Milan during a working meeting and use a coupon for a medium pizza, 3 topings, 2 soda cans and a house salad.  Milan said deliver would be between 45min-1hr.  Our order arrived in 35 minutes, steaming hot pizza, ice cold sodas, fresh garden salad enough for 4 people...all for $17.51 after tax!  Sooo good!
author: Redloci R.

description: Perfect prompt, tasty pizza well-suited for finishing a long night of drinks at Swig and Rye.
author: Mark A.

description: This place has the best pizza. My wife and I were on our honeymoon and ordered pizza to be delivered to our room. It only took 30 min and cost less than $20 for a large two topping.
author: Jeremy T.

description: Good stuff! It's bad news for the other pizza joints that the first place I ordered from in my new neighborhood was so tasty.
author: charlotte c.

description: Yum!  This has to be the best late night pizza I've found in the city, and for dirt cheap.  Plus every time I go in the guys behind the counter are super nice (and patient when I can't decide what I want due to that last drink at the bar).  Love it :)
author: Stephanie B.

description: I am only visiting San Francisco, but after spending an hour online reading reviews of pizza places I ordered from here. The pizza was great! The delivery was an hour, which was when they said it would be and although a little on the colder side, what can you expect when it probably took 20 minutes to deliver to me. Overall, liked it alot and was pleased with service.
author: Sarah S.

description:
love me some pizza at 2 in the am wtih my buddy!

good price, good tase, yummy!

The slices are pretty big.  If you can get a fresh slice it tastes so much better (with any pizza duh)

They have the usual slices like supreme, hawaian, cheese ect. You can always request your random topping combo too though which is really nice. 

The crust/bread/dough is very good.  It's nice and crunchy when you bite so it's not a sloppy pizza.  

The staff is very nice.  Small joint, few people but very very good.  Not a lot of place to sit so it's a place to get pizza and get going!
author: Erika C.

description: Pretty good pizza. Fast and tasty, but not the greatest i've ever had. There's plenty of pizza joints in nob hill and they all taste about the same. Milan's is a tad bit better, but I have to say the OWNER gets 5 STARS! He's great and i keep coming back simply to hear "how are you doing my friend?"
author: Joshua L.

description: This is the first place I ate at in San Francisco and it was good.  For some reason my dad really liked the crust, but he puts ketchup on everything so sometimes he's not to be trusted.  Not amazing, but not bad.
author: Andrew R.

description:
This place is ok. They have decent pizza, burgers, and less than decent appetizers, but they are open til 3am which is a plus.

I've seen some of the bad reviews. Okay, the staff is not that intelligent but they get the job done and the food is good so who cares.
author: g m.

description: More mediocre pizza joint in nob hill.
author: Jason R.

description: The pizza is pretty good. I mean, it's not Cybelle's quality, but definitely a step above the other terdy pizza joints around the Tenderloin. The phone order can take up to about 5 minutes because the people working the phones probably shouldn't be. Once they mistook a Dew and a Dr. Pepper for two Root Beers. Then they got our number wrong, so we didn't get a pizza for over an hour. But such is life, right? My boyfriend and I get some coupon deal with a medium 3 topping, salad (chock full of olives + red onions), and two soda pops - 15 bucks or so. Not bad.
author: Brittany L.

description: This place has the best calzones I've ever tasted!!!  We got the Milan Calzone, a small-and it was huge! The ingrediants were fresh and it only took 10 minutes to make.  I would go back for another in a heartbeat.
author: Badder T.

description: BEST PIZZA IN CALIFORNIA!!  I live in san Francisco right down the street form this pizza place and my boyfriend and I eat here at less ones a week. people are so friendly, pizza always hot and fresh, really made to order. i love it here so good best ive ever had for sure!
author: LoLa L.

description:
I go here almost every day to have my slice of cheese pizza, which is excellent. I have tried many pizzerias in San Francisco, all over, and this is with no question the best cheese slice there is. I come from Argentina, so we are pizza specialists.

The place is small, very clean, with a few tables in the back where I usually sit and savor.
author: Daniel S.

description: Definitely San Francisco's best pizza place. It's cheap and delicious. I go there every time I go to the city. I highly recommend their famous "Ja Pasta" It is to die for. Its Feta cheese, pesto, and tomatoes. They also deliver and are open crazy late.
author: Jessie E.

description: I am giving it three stars because their sauce has flavor, they do not skimp on the toppings, they are open very late and the single slices are huge. I did encounter a penny in my pizza one night and no doubt from some drunken fool that maybe chucked a bunch of change in the air. The dough is a bit too thick for my liking but overall, I never experienced it undercooked or burnt. They are very friendly and accomodating toward not only the derelicts in the neighborhood but also the vegatarian, drug addicted, retarded hipsters. My only dissapointment is that the Palistinian family that ran it before, left. Best Shawirma (oops, don't know how to spell it), I have ever had. It was the Mother's family recipe and it was off the hook, amazing. Her son had to call her down to make one anytime it was ordered (she wouldn't even give her recipe to her son :) Basically as for Pizza Milano, it was the only Pizza option in my neighborhood that was passable/not highway robbery and open late night. I work nights so....  it worked for me at that time!
author: Out O.

description: Good pizza that fills me up every time!
author: Brittany A.

description: tonight i made friends with MO and AJ... they are the most awesome pizza guys. they totally took care of me and my roomie when we needed our pizza and wings fix. and then they told me that they deliver... I'M IN HEAVEN. when you go there tell them that jamie part two sent you.
author: jamie b.

description: milan pizza, ohh what to say about this little pizza shop. good reasonable pricces, friendly service and late hours will definatey keep you coming back, the crowd that comes here are whats nice about the place; right after a nite out on tha town this is a usual spot for alot of SF residents, usually you'll see someone throwing up outside on the sidewalk or a big circle of strangers just conversing about how their night was...the pizza isnt going to win any awards but its delicious enough to keep on coming back. not going there in tha daytime tho, rather be there latenite
author: Nikko I.

description: I live right next store to Milan and come here whenever I order pizza. Compared to most places in the city- Milan is always fresh, tasty. and always hearty. The crust, sauce and cheese combonations are always perfect. The only downside to this place is individual slices- they sit out, so order fresh! Their hours are awesome and the location is convienant to most people. Enjoy!
author: Chris S.

description: SLOW delivery and my order was incomplete and cold when it arrived.  I didn't like the food, and I won't brave the long wait again.
author: Shannon G.

description: they should change their name from Milan Pizza to Good F*ckin Pizza! and that's saying alot coming from someone that only likes pizza when he's drunk.
author: Mike A.
